Title: CRM Data Analyst
HTML:
Unipol Assicurazioni S.p.A., compagnia multi-ramo del Gruppo Unipol, leader in Italia nei rami Danni, per un rafforzamento delle proprie iniziative di customer analysis a supporto dello sviluppo commerciale, è alla ricerca di un professionista da inserire nel contesto della Direzione Marketing e Comunicazione Commerciale nel ruolo di:


CRM Data Analyst


Sede di lavoro: Milano/Bologna


Il profilo ricercato, inserito gruppo di lavoro “Targeting & Business Intelligence”, avrà l’obiettivo di identificare le informazioni chiave per la individuazione e segmentazione dei cluster della clientela allo scopo di avviare azioni di marketing integrate.

In particolare, gestirà le seguenti attività:


  • Costruire target list a supporto delle campagne commerciali, utilizzando approcci avanzati come l’analisi look-alike, basata sulle caratteristiche e i comportamenti assicurativi della clientela;
  • Implementare e manutenere segmentazioni strategiche della clientela, con un focus specifico sui clienti ad alto potenziale, al fine di abilitare offerte personalizzate e modelli di servizio dedicati;
  • Definire e applicare modelli predittivi per l’analisi dei bisogni assicurativi attuali e futuri, sia in ottica di riduzione del churn sia di sviluppo commerciale (es. alberi decisionali, random forest, Basket Recommendation Engine);
  • Presidiare le attività di Business Intelligence, attraverso la realizzazione di dashboard orientate ai principali KPI cliente (stock e trend) e la produzione di reportistica a supporto del monitoraggio delle performance commerciali;
  • Ideare e sviluppare use case finalizzati a stimare l’impatto potenziale delle future iniziative di marketing, valorizzando appieno i dati disponibili.


REQUISITI RICHIESTI:


  • Laurea magistrale preferibilmente in Scienze Statistiche o ad indirizzo quantitativo conseguita con ottima votazione;
  • Esperienza professionale di almeno 2/3 anni nel ruolo di CRM Data Analyst acquisita in contesti di business B2B2C;
  • Conoscenza SQL, SAS, SPSS, R o di altri linguaggi di programmazione finalizzati all’analisi dei dati per la definizione del target ottimale;
  • Conoscenza ad un livello avanzato di Microsoft Office (in particolare PowerPoint, Excel, Access);
  • Solida esperienza nell’applicazione di modelli di machine learning, sia supervisionati (es. regressione logistica, alberi decisionali) sia non supervisionati (es. clustering), finalizzati a segmentazione, propensione all’acquisto e churn prediction;
  • Capacità di sintesi e di presentazione dei risultati, anche grazie a tool di data visualization.


Rappresenta un requisito preferenziale per la selezione avere acquisito una generale conoscenza della normativa privacy e, in generale, del GDPR.


Il candidato in possesso delle competenze ed esperienze richieste sarà inserito con rapporto di lavoro a tempo indeterminato ai sensi del CCNL Imprese di Assicurazione.


La ricerca è rivolta a candidati ambosessi ai sensi della L. 903/77 e D.lgs. 198/2006.

Title: Data Analyst Marketing and Growth - Italy
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION


Understand business needs and create insightful analysis helping your team to make the right decisions to boost Glovo presence and orders
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base focusing on traffic, conversion and retention rates and leveraging on levers such as pricing, promotions, events, CRM and other marketing levers etc
Drive projects end-to-end translating business challenges into insights and actions
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base, step change retention rates and maximize profitability
Take ownership of the reporting of KPIs by creating customized tools and using the available ones
Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date
Assist your colleagues in gaining access to the right data, and communicate and simplify concepts to the audience's needs
Drive clarity and solve ambiguity using data-driven approaches
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with both our consumer and business products, identify growth opportunities, and execute projects to drive growth and engagement


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of work experience on analytical roles leading analysis and turning insights into actions
Bachelor's degree in Math, Engineering, Business, Stats, Quantitative field or Business
SQL proficiency is mandatory / Python is a plus
Ninja expertise with Excel / Google Sheets is a must
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau and Looker
Business acumen and passion for end-to-end project management (from ideation and analysis into implementation)
A hands-on attitude is a must. You’ll have to roll up your sleeves!
Proficiency in English
Strong consumer understanding skills


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Internship
Description:
Job description:

Business Intelligence Intern (Global/International) Location: Milan, Italy 

 Role Purpose

 We are looking for a motivated and talented intern to join our Business Intelligence team. The ideal candidate will have a strong passion for data analysis and the ability to transform complex information into valuable business insights on a global scale. Key responsibilities will include supporting project execution, participating in the analysis, development, and maintenance of Business Intelligence, Big Data, and Analytics solutions. The candidate will operate in line with requirements and the technical landscape, adopting best practices and adhering to external regulations. Requirements: • Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or related fields (also in progress).• Basic knowledge of Business Intelligence tools.• Analytical skills and attention to detail.• Good communication skills and teamwork abilities.• Proficiency in English. Main Responsibilities: • Assist in the collection and management of data from various international business sources.• Supporting data analysis using BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, and SQL. Training to be provided where suitable.• Creation of reports and dashboards to present analysis results.• Collaboration with the team to understand business needs and provide data-driven solutions.• Providing support in the maintenance and management of the company's Data Warehouse and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes.• Supporting the supervisor in gathering and evaluating business requirements to ensure they are correctly collected and technically feasible.• Assisting the supervisor in regular maintenance of BI/Big Data and Analytics, in line with requirements and the technical landscape.• Drafting and supporting documentation to accurately represent business processes and train end users on new solutions in conjunction with the supervisor.• For the area of responsibility, supporting the supervisor in executing project activities to ensure initiatives are completed on time and within budget.• Collaborating with business functions in reviewing technical documents to ensure alignment with business requirements.• Assisting with the execution all testing phases, in line with test plans, to monitor the correct functioning of implemented applications.• Support the provision of training to end users and day to day services to ensure smooth adoption of BI applications.• Supporting IT support services and business end users in resolving complex issues to ensure they are resolved with minimal disruption. What We Offer: Opportunities for learning and professional growth in an international context.Dynamic and stimulating work environment.Chance to work on innovative and impactful global projects

This announcement is addressed to applicants of both sexes (L. 903/77 - D.Lgs n. 198/2006) and also to those belonging to Protected Categories (L.68/99).

The ideal candidate will have a strong passion for data analysis and the ability to transform complex information into valuable business insights on a global scale. Key responsibilities will include supporting project execution, participating in the analysis, development, and maintenance of Business Intelligence, Big Data, and Analytics solutions. The candidate will operate in line with requirements and the technical landscape, adopting best practices and adhering to external regulations. Requirements: • Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or related fields (also in progress).• Basic knowledge of Business Intelligence tools.• Analytical skills and attention to detail.• Good communication skills and teamwork abilities.• Proficiency in English. Main Responsibilities: • Assist in the collection and management of data from various international business sources.• Supporting data analysis using BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, and SQL. Training to be provided where suitable.• Creation of reports and dashboards to present analysis results.• Collaboration with the team to understand business needs and provide data-driven solutions.• Providing support in the maintenance and management of the company's Data Warehouse and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes.• Supporting the supervisor in gathering and evaluating business requirements to ensure they are correctly collected and technically feasible.• Assisting the supervisor in regular maintenance of BI/Big Data and Analytics, in line with requirements and the technical landscape.• Drafting and supporting documentation to accurately represent business processes and train end users on new solutions in conjunction with the supervisor.• For the area of responsibility, supporting the supervisor in executing project activities to ensure initiatives are completed on time and within budget.• Collaborating with business functions in reviewing technical documents to ensure alignment with business requirements.• Assisting with the execution all testing phases, in line with test plans, to monitor the correct functioning of implemented applications.• Support the provision of training to end users and day to day services to ensure smooth adoption of BI applications.• Supporting IT support services and business end users in resolving complex issues to ensure they are resolved with minimal disruption. What We Offer: Opportunities for learning and professional growth in an international context.Dynamic and stimulating work environment.Chance to work on innovative and impactful global projects

This announcement is addressed to applicants of both sexes (L. 903/77 - D.Lgs n. 198/2006) and also to those belonging to Protected Categories (L.68/99).

Title: Junior Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Description:
La risorsa collaborerà a un progetto strategico di mappatura, normalizzazione e analisi di dati internazionali, affiancherà il responsabile di progetto nella definizione e implementazione di strumenti e processi per la raccolta, integrazione, confronto e visualizzazione di dati eterogenei provenienti da fonti e contesti geografici differenti.

Attività:


Raccogliere, pulire e strutturare dataset provenienti da diverse fonti, con particolare attenzione ai file Excel.
Analizzare e mappare correttamente le variabili e le strutture dati per facilitarne la comparabilità.
Eseguire operazioni di normalizzazione su dati sensibili a contesto, come valute, unità di misura, codifiche prodotto e nomenclature locali.
Collaborare alla progettazione e allo sviluppo di dashboard comparative per supportare analisi multi-country.
Contribuire alla documentazione tecnica e alla comunicazione dei risultati analitici ai diversi stakeholder.



Requisiti:


Ottima padronanza di Microsoft Excel, incluse funzioni avanzate, tabelle pivot e strumenti di pulizia dati.
Conoscenze base di Python, in particolare delle librerie pandas, numpy e strumenti di visualizzazione come matplotlib o plotly.
Familiarità con i concetti fondamentali di ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) e data visualization.
Attitudine all’analisi critica e capacità di comunicare in modo chiaro gli insight emersi dall’analisi dei dati.
Precisione, spirito collaborativo e voglia di crescere in un ambiente dinamico e internazionale.
Esperienza (anche accademica) in progetti di data analysis o business intelligence.
Conoscenze base di strumenti di visualizzazione come Power BI o Tableau.



Sede: Milano

Data inizio: ASAP

Tipologia contrattuale: valutata in base all'esperienza e alle competenze, consulente in Partita Iva

Title: Freelance Data Analyst (Python) - AI Trainer
Description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Data Analysis, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Triple-check some delivery data and ensure client expectations are reflected in every batch
Generate prompts that challenge AI
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge
Ensure taxonomies are logical, consistent, and aligned with operational needs



How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, Mathematics
You have at least 3 years of professional experience in Data Analysis
You have experience with prompt engineering (basic to intermediate level) and have Basic-to-Intermediate Python Scripting and SQL understanding
You are proficient in spreadsheet tools such as Google Sheets, Excel
You have experience with interpreting data visualization & reporting (e.g., dashboards)
You have a strong command of taxonomy and classification design
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge



Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Sales Data Analyst
Description:
We’re Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We’re all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What You’ll Do & Who You Are

We are seeking a Sales Data Analyst with expertise in data analysis to help optimize sales strategies and support our B2B sales team. The ideal candidate will transform platform data into actionable insights to identify business opportunities, improve sales performance, and inform strategic decision-making.

Key Responsibilities


Analyze data from the company’s digital platform (user traffic, behavior, conversions, etc.) to support the sales team
Identify usage patterns and propose strategies to enhance customer value.
Develop detailed reports and dashboards to monitor sales performance based on platform data
Collaborate with product, marketing, data, and sales teams to align initiatives with insights generated from data analysis
Segment customers and analyze data to support targeted initiatives (e.g., upselling, cross-selling, retention)
Provide sales forecasts using platform data and predictive models
Monitor key performance indicators (e.g., acquisition rate, churn rate) to refine sales strategies
Automate analysis processes to improve efficiency and speed in delivering insights.


Your Identikit


Strong ability to communicate complex data insights clearly and effectively to stakeholders
Excellent analytical thinking and attention to detail
Ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams (product, sales, marketing, data)
Adaptability and comfort in a fast-paced, dynamic environment


Required Skills And Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Science, or a related field
Minimum of 3 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within digital platform or e-commerce environments
Strong proficiency in SQL
Proficiency in data analysis programming languages, preferably Python
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Knowledge of statistical techniques for business-oriented data analysis


Nice To Have


Experience with machine learning models for customer segmentation, churn prediction, and sales forecasting
Familiarity with cloud platforms, particularly AWS
Understanding of digital analytics and experience with web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics)


Benefits


Competitive compensation package
Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
‘Work from anywhere’ weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more


For each working day, you will be eligible for a €8 meal voucher. You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.
Show more

  • Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
  • ‘Work from anywhere’ weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
  • Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a €8 meal voucher. You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
HTML:
Per conto di una prestigiosa multinazionale, leader nel settore delle macchine utensili, siamo alla ricerca di un/una:


Junior Data Analyst

(17/25)


La figura sarà inserita all’interno del team di Coordinamento Assistenza Tecnica, che costituisce insieme alle vendite un’attività altamente strategica e di business.

Il/la candidato/a riporterà a un Project Manager e si occuperà di analizzare e organizzare i dati raccolti, al fine di supportare le strategie aziendali.


Nello specifico le sue mansioni saranno:


  • analizzare ed elaborare i dati recepiti da diverse fonti aziendali;
  • creare report dettagliati e dashboard per il monitoraggio dei KPI esistenti, o definiti ex novo insieme al Project Manager, e per la presentazione al management;
  • identificare tendenze, criticità e opportunità attraverso analisi statistiche e modelli predittivi;
  • collaborare con i diversi team del Service e le altre funzioni aziendali per comprenderne le esigenze e supportare le strategie aziendali, con l’obiettivo di efficientare e ottimizzare i risultati del dipartimento;
  • ottimizzare e migliorare i processi di gestione e analisi dei dati.


Requisiti


Il/la candidato/a ideale possiede preferibilmente una laurea in Ingegneria Gestionale o in discipline affini, ha maturato almeno 2/3 anni di esperienza in ruoli simili (la provenienza da settori produttivi sarà considerata un plus).


Completano il profilo:

  • ottima capacità di utilizzo di MS Office, in particolare MS Excel;
  • buona dimestichezza con software gestionali ERP;
  • un’ottima conoscenza degli strumenti di analisi e visualizzazione dei dati, quali Power BI o similari;
  • eccellenti capacità analitiche, di problem solving e di comunicazione;
  • una buona conoscenza della lingua inglese;
  • la capacità di lavorare sia in modo indipendente sia in team.


Si richiede inoltre la disponibilità ad effettuare trasferte presso le altre sedi italiane dell’azienda.


Sede di Lavoro: Milano Ovest.


La ricerca è estesa a entrambi i sessi (L. 903/77)


Telema s.r.l. è una società autorizzata dal Ministero del Lavoro e delle Politiche Sociali a svolgere l'attività di Ricerca e Selezione del Personale col n.° Prot. n° 4415 - 12 febbraio 2007. I dati saranno trattati esclusivamente ai fini di Ricerca di Personale e saranno conservati anche per ricerche future. Sono garantiti i diritti di cui al D.lgs.196/03. Le ricerche sono rivolte a persone di entrambe i sessi (L. 903/77).

Title: Data Analyst Stage curriculare
Description:
Come Data Analyst Curricular Intern, avrai l'opportunità di analizzare le performance delle campagne digitali, con particolare attenzione ai KPI di funnel e media. Sarai responsabile della raccolta e dell'organizzazione dei dati da fonti interne ed esterne, contribuendo a pulire e correggere eventuali errori nei sistemi di raccolta e archiviazione dei dati. In questo ruolo, fornirai report dettagliati e documenti con i risultati delle analisi, presentandoli agli stakeholder interni e supportando il cliente in analisi ad hoc per sbloccare insights chiave.




Le tue responsabilità:

• Analizzare le performance delle campagne digitali, con particolare attenzione ai KPI di funnel e media.

• Raccogliere dati da fonti interne ed esterne, organizzarli e strutturarli per la pulizia dei database, correggendo eventuali errori nei sistemi di raccolta e archiviazione.

• Creare report e documenti dettagliati con i risultati delle analisi da presentare agli stakeholder interni.

• Supportare il cliente in analisi ad hoc e richieste specifiche per ottenere insight strategici.

Competenze tecniche:

• Passione per l'analisi dei dati, individuazione di pattern e anomalie, con capacità di risolverli.

• Esperienza consolidata con software come Power BI, Tableau, Qlik; esperienza con Adobe è un plus.

• Conoscenza del pacchetto Office.




Competenze trasversali:

• Capacità di operare in ambienti di lavoro complessi, fluidi e dinamici.

• Fluente in inglese (sia scritto che parlato).




Cosa offriamo:

• Stage curriculare retribuito con possibilità di lavoro ibrido.

• Possibilità di partecipare a conferenze ed eventi formativi.

• Accesso a benefit aziendali attraverso i nostri partner.




Conosci Publicis Sapient?

Publicis Sapient è una società globale di consulenza digitale e tecnologica parte di Publicis Groupe, specializzata nella trasformazione digitale. La nostra missione è aiutare le aziende a ottimizzare processi e migliorare l'esperienza del cliente attraverso l'uso di soluzioni digitali avanzate.




DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSION

Come parte del nostro impegno per una forza lavoro inclusiva e diversificata, Publicis Sapient è dedicata alla parità di opportunità di impiego senza distinzione di razza, colore, origine nazionale, etnia, genere, status di veterano protetto, disabilità, orientamento sessuale, identità di genere o religione. Siamo inoltre impegnati a fornire sistemazioni ragionevoli per individui qualificati con disabilità e veterani disabili nelle nostre procedure di candidatura.

Show more

Title: Sales Data Analyst
HTML:
Chi siamo?

ELIS, multinazionale leader in Europa nei servizi a noleggio di abbigliamento professionale e nella gestione dell'igiene, della disinfezione e della disinfestazione, è un'azienda che punta fortemente sulla formazione continua e sulle sue persone. È una delle poche aziende in Italia ad aver ottenuto la certificazione sulla parità di genere impegnandosi per promuovere un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo ed equo per tutti.


Chi stiamo cercando?

Per la nostra sede di San Giuliano Milanese ricerchiamo un* Sales Data Analyst che affiancherà principalmente il Direttore Vendite nell’analisi dei dati e i risultati del reparto vendite, in particolare:


  • gestione e organizzazione del lavoro dell’assistenza direzione vendite;
  • reportistica e analisi dati a fine mese da condividere con il proprio responsabile e il team di vendita;
  • monitoraggio della formazione “Sales Academy” della forza vendita;
  • collaborazione nell’organizzazione di eventi aziendali sia interni (staff meeting), sia esterni (fiere di settore etc.).


Cosa ti offriamo?

  • Programma di integrazione e di inserimento nel mondo Elis;
  • contratto a Tempo Indeterminato (CCNL Multiservizi);
  • retribuzione Annua Lorda 30.000 € (valutata in base all’esperienza);
  • premio variabile;
  • assicurazione sanitaria;
  • buoni pasto da 7 €.


Cosa ti chiediamo?

  • Minima esperienza di gestione di persone (almeno un anno);
  • laurea in economia e commercio, business administration, sales&marketing management (ad esempio);
  • conoscenza della lingua inglese, almeno B2;
  • che MS Excel sia il tuo miglior amico;
  • mindset da “data miner”;
  • che le scadenze e gli obiettivi siano il tuo pane quotidiano;
  • la classica conoscenza di MS Office (Power BI sarebbe TOP);
  • tanta proattività e fermezza.


Non ti abbiamo ancora convinto?

Visita il nostro sito e scopri chi è ELIS e com'è posizionata nel Mondo: www.elis.com.


Nel rispetto della Legge n. 68/99, ELIS Italia accoglie in via prioritaria le candidature delle Categorie Protette.


Dal 2024, ELIS Italia è anche certificata UNI ISO 45001 (sistema di gestione su sicurezza e ambiente) e UNI/PdR 125:2022 (sulla Parità di Genere).


I dati personali rilasciati saranno trattati per finalità di ricerca e selezione da parte di ELIS Italia S.p.A. in riferimento al D. Lgs 196/2003 (Codice Privacy) e del Regolamento UE n. 679/2016 (GDPR). L’autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali ai fini dell’iter di selezione dovrà essere specificata dal candidato all’interno del CV inviato.


Per maggiori informazioni, vi rimandiamo alla Nostra pagina dedicata: https://it.elis.com/it/gdpr-policy.

Title: Data Analyst (SaS, Power BI) | Leading Insurance Company
Description:
La tua nuova azienda




Il nostro cliente è il leader italiano nel settore assicurativo in ambito sanitario.

Grazie a +15 anni di esperienza e oltre 200 dipendenti, la realtà è ad oggi il partner di riferimento per ospedali, ambulatori e professionisti.

La società si distingue per la costruzione di soluzioni assicurative personalizzate che vengono affiancate a moderne e dettagliate tecniche di analisi dati e risk management.




Il tuo nuovo ruolo




All’interno della BU Market Analysis, stiamo ricercando un Data Analyst a diretto riporto dell'UW Lead.

Inserita in un processo di totale revisione dei tool di reportistica, la figura sarà responsabile della creazione di nuove dashboard e monitoraggio di quelle esistenti (linee di business, prodotti assicurativi, princing, rischio, etc.).




La risorsa collaborerà quindi con il team Underwriting (UW) e fungerà da punto di contatto con il team IT per tutte le tematiche correlate al mondo Data.

Si occuperà quindi della definizione delle necessità di business, estrapolazione e riconciliazione del dato, creazione della reportista e analisi degli insight.




Parallelamente, saranno inoltre necessarie attività di manutenzione periodica delle dashboard esistenti e di analisi ad hoc (nuovi clienti/progetti, mercato, etc.).




Di cosa hai bisogno per avere successo




Richiediamo almeno uno/due anni anno di esperienza in ruoli analoghi assieme ad un solido percorso accademico.

Ricerchiamo inoltre ottime competenze lato programmazione in SaS e gestione DB, oltre a buona padronanza di Power BI e R (o Python).




Cosa avrai in cambio




Salary package e inquadramento saranno funzione dell’esperienza effettiva e dei valori di partenza.

Sede di lavoro: Milano centro, con buona flessibilità lato smart working.




Cosa devi fare ora




Se sei interessato a questa opportunità, clicca su "Candidarsi ora" per inviare una copia aggiornata del tuo CV.

Se questa opportunità non è in linea con le tue aspettative, ma sei alla ricerca di un nuovo lavoro, visita il nostro sito Internet per scoprirne di nuove.




I candidati di ambo i sessi, dopo aver visionato l'informativa obbligatoria sulla privacy sul sito www.hays.it, sono pregati di inviare il CV.

Hays S.r.l. Agenzia per il Lavoro Accreditata: Aut. Min. N. 13/I/0007145/03.04 del 1 Aprile 2008

Title: CONTRACT DATA ANALYST
Description:
Chi cerchiamo

Per la nostra sede di Milano (Piazza Trento) siamo alla ricerca di una persona da inserire come CONTRACT DATA ANALYST all’interno della struttura Customer Rating & Contract Management. La struttura ha la principale responsabilità di gestire i contratti stipulati dalla Società con i fornitori di servizi, supportando le competenti Strutture Organizzative di A2A SpA nello screening delle opportunità di mercato e nella definizione delle specifiche contrattuali, nonché monitorando i livelli di servizio e il rispetto degli SLA da parte dei fornitori;

Per quale Società 

A2A Energia. Società del Gruppo A2A che fornisce energia a oltre 2,5 milioni di clienti, costantemente ai vertici delle rilevazioni nazionali per il livello di soddisfazione. Presenza costante per i cittadini, in casa e nella città, porta nel loro mondo comfort e servizi innovativi per favorire l’efficienza energetica e la mobilità elettrica. Si impegna ogni giorno per offrire un servizio di qualità, che risponda alle esigenze più diverse, dal singolo alla grande azienda.

Ti occuperai di


Contribuire al monitoraggio dei fornitori, attraverso la gestione degli applicativi aziendali che registrano l’attività del fornitore. In particolare, è necessario monitorare il corretto svolgimento dell’attività e i dati di pre-fattura, nonché fornire alle strutture preposte i dati di stanziamento e di budget
Predisporre la reportistica di andamento del servizio dei fornitori
Gestire le richieste del business, interfacciandosi con le strutture di A2A Energia e con la struttura Digital e veicolarle verso il fornitore
Predisporre i benestare al pagamento delle fatture, attraverso gli applicativi aziendali
Contribuire alla gestione delle modifiche, degli aggiornamenti e delle implementazioni relative alla documentazione contrattuale (contratti, comunicazioni, modulistica) destinata ai clienti finali di A2A Energia (mercati diversi dal mercato libero) e monitorare l’avanzamento dei ticket, verificare gli UAT (test di prova) e monitorare la messa in produzione delle modifiche apportate.


Sei la persona giusta se ti riconosci in questo profilo


Diploma o Laurea in materie scientifiche
Competenze analitiche nella lavorazione ed interpretazione dei dati
Conoscenza del pacchetto Office (Excel/Access)
Capacità di lettura e comprensione di documentazione contrattuale
Rappresenta un plus l’esperienza pregressa di 1-2 anni nel campo dell’analisi dati in aziende del settore Energy/Utility, Telecomunicazioni o in aziende di consulenza per clienti finali in questi settori
Rappresenta un plus la conoscenza degli applicativi Qlik View, Qlik Sense, Google Cloud Platform o altri linguaggi di programmazione
Completano il profilo: flessibilità, dinamicità, orientamento al teamworking, capacità relazionali con stakeholder interni ed esterni, concretezza e spirito collaborativo, problem solving, proattività e iniziativa, autonomia, gestione dello stress e delle priorità, capacità di analisi e di pianificazione/organizzazione del lavoro.


Che cosa offriamo


Flessibilità: settimana lavorativa con venerdì a orario ridotto, flessibilità negli orari di entrata/uscita e pausa pranzo; Smartworking sino al 60% dell’orario di lavoro su base bimestrale
Buoni pasto elettronici
Salute e benessere: assistenza sanitaria integrativa, supporto psicologico attraverso counseling, webinar dedicati al benessere psicofisico e vaccino antinfluenzale
Famiglia: A2A Life Caring, iniziativa a supporto della genitorialità attraverso un mese aggiuntivo retribuito al 100% per maternità/paternità, rimborsi spese per figli, convenzioni con asili nido, team coaching per neogenitori; spazio caregiver, offriamo webinar e uno spazio di ascolto dedicati a chi si prende cura di persone fragili o non autosufficienti
Formazione e sviluppo: programma di induction dedicato ai nuovi assunti, gestione dei talenti, corsi di formazione e possibilità di crescita interna e job rotation tramite candidatura interna
Risparmio e tempo libero: oltre 300 convenzioni, tra cui trasporti pubblici, attività sportive, viaggi, eventi culturali, e offerte speciali per luce e gas. Opzioni per il car sharing e la conversione del premio di risultato in benefit di welfare
Ambiente di lavoro: promuoviamo una cultura che valorizza la diversità, l’equità e l'inclusione (DE&I); potrai inoltre avere la possibilità di unirti a un team dedicato allo sviluppo di iniziative e progetti su queste tematiche. Sosteniamo l'evoluzione tecnologica e offriamo strumenti e risorse per promuovere il lavoro digitale.


Saranno valutate esclusivamente le candidature inviate tramite il Sito Carriere aziendale. 

Ci impegniamo ogni giorno per creare un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo e innovativo, fondato sul rispetto, sull’etica e sulle pari opportunità garantendo la valorizzazione delle diversità.

La selezione è rivolta a candidati e candidate in linea con le competenze richieste. I dati personali raccolti verranno trattati nel rispetto del Regolamento Ue 2016/679 (GDPR).

Scopri di più sul Gruppo a2a

Opportunità di lavoro   https://t.ly/CiTRn

Le nostre persone   https://t.ly/djoa3

Formazione  https://t.ly/Nr5Fr

Ascolta “Accanto”, il Podcast che racconta cosa significa oggi lavorare in A2A  https://t.ly/pRaU4

Per conoscere il nostro processo di selezione e prepararti al meglio al colloquio

Consigli per l’iter di selezione   https://t.ly/N6pil

Processo di selezione   https://t.ly/iGij7

Title: Data Visualization Specialist
Description:
CHI SIAMO?




IDATA GROUP è un System Integrator, nato nel 1979 e da oltre 40 anni lavora a supporto delle aziende in Italia e all’ Estero.

Grazie alle competenze acquisite negli anni, offriamo servizi di:

Sviluppo software, web, mobile, embedded, IOT
Cloud
Cybersecurity: PT, WAPT, VA, Digital Identity, DLP, Data Protection, Governance, Corporate Security
Data Analysis e Data Engineering
Business Intelligence
Sistemi GIS
Project Management e Integrazione di sistemi Innovativi







CHE RUOLO TI PROPONIAMO?




Data Visualization Specialist




Sei alla ricerca di un team dove poter condividere le tue idee, crescere professionalmente e mettere in pratica la tua passione per l'analisi dei dati e la Business Intelligence?

Perfetto, sei nel posto giusto!

Lavorando con noi come Data Visualization Specialist, collaborerai con un team che segue progetti internazionali e innovativi, proponendo e realizzando soluzioni di Business Intelligence con diversi strumenti, tra cui QlikSense, Power BI e altri tool di visualizzazione.







COSA CERCHIAMO IN TE?




Laurea in Ingegneria Informatica, Informatica, Ingegneria Gestionale o affini
Conoscenza degli strumenti per la manipolazione, visualizzazione e analisi dei dati
Esperienza pregressa di 1-2 anni con Qlik Sense o Power BI
Capacità di lavorare con database e linguaggi di programmazione come SQL, DAX, Python
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese







DOVE LAVORERAI?




La sede di lavoro è Milano, con la possibilità di lavorare in modalità ibrida.







COSA PROPONE IL TEAM IDATA?




Contratto e Benefit: inserimento immediato con contratto CCNL Commercio e Servizi del Terziario;

Benefit: ticket restaurant e assicurazione sanitaria integrativa

Lavorerai con: PC Aziendale

Si lavora dal lunedì al venerdì, full time 40 ore settimanali, dalle 9 alle 18 (orario indicativo).

L’inquadramento economico verrà valutato dalla azienda a seconda delle esperienze maturate

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
GS1 Italy è l’organizzazione non profit che, a partire dall'introduzione rivoluzionaria del codice a barre nel 1973, sviluppa gli standard più utilizzati al mondo per la comunicazione tra imprese.

In Italia, GS1 Italy riunisce 40 mila imprese in tutti settori chiave. Oggi più che mai le imprese devono garantire ai consumatori accesso immediato a informazioni complete e affidabili. I sistemi standard, i processi condivisi ECR, i servizi e gli osservatori di ricerca che GS1 Italy mette a disposizione permettono alle aziende di creare esperienze gratificanti per il consumatore, aumentare la trasparenza, ridurre i costi e definire scelte imprenditoriali strategiche e sostenibili. In breve, con GS1 la trasformazione digitale è più semplice e più veloce.




GS1 Italy è alla ricerca di un/una Business Intelligence Specialist per potenziare il team di Business Partner all’ interno dell’area Marketing, Communication & Research




Descrizione del ruolo e delle responsabilità:

Nello specifico si occuperà di:

gestire in prima persona la produzione degli Osservatori di GS1 Italy /GS1 Italy Servizi, si relazionerà con i fornitori e sarà un punto di riferimento interno per tutti i contenuti.
manutenere e ottimizzare le Dashboard interne dell’Organizzazione diventando un supporto fondamentale per le analisi di business destinate ai Reparti interni.
coordinare e collaborare in tutte le ricerche ad hoc sviluppate in ambito GS1 Italy e GS1 Italy Servizi
relazionarsi con Project manager e i Data Analyst dei diversi dipartimenti dell’Organizzazione e vivrà esperienze di collaborazione a livello internazionale in gruppi di lavoro tematici.
presidiare la gestione e l’analisi dei dati derivanti sia da fonti esterne che interne




Esperienza Professionale

La figura ideale ha una laurea Economia, Marketing, Statistica, o affini e ha maturato un’esperienza di almeno 2 anni in un ruolo simile. Ha dimestichezza con la gestione e interpretazione dei dati: dal controllo dei numeri alla loro migliore rappresentazione grafica. Curioso, meticoloso e puntuale, conosce bene l’utilizzo di Excel e dei principali strumenti di posta elettronica. Saranno considerati elementi preferenziali la conoscenza del mondo del Largo consumo (provenienza da Istituti di ricerca e/o data provider (es.NielsenIQ, Circana, GFK, etc.), l’utilizzo di Tableau (o tool simili), la programmazione in Phyton.




Competenze richieste:

Orientato al problem solving e al team working
Curiosità e proattività
Pensiero analitico
Capacità organizzative
Capacità comunicative scritte e verbali
Conoscenza di Excell (alto livello: Macro, Funzioni, Pivot, etc.)
Competenze in data management e data analysis
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
Competenze di Data visualization (Tableau è preferenziale)
Basi di programmazione (Python) – opzionale




Offriamo un Contratto a tempo indeterminato, inserimento in un contesto giovane e in crescita, flessibilità, smart working, welfare e benefit.

Show more

  • Competenze di Data visualization (Tableau è preferenziale)
  • Basi di programmazione (Python) – opzionale


Offriamo un Contratto a tempo indeterminato, inserimento in un contesto giovane e in crescita, flessibilità, smart working, welfare e benefit.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Satispay

Satispay was born to revolutionise everyday payments – making them simple, fair, and accessible to everyone. Now, the focus has moved even further, aiming to shape the future of money.

We're a movement empowering millions of people, driven by a shared purpose to tackle big challenges. And we're just getting started. We move quickly, think boldly, and trust each other to challenge the norm, learning and growing as we go.

If you're looking for more than just your next job – if you want to build something impactful with a talented team – you're in the right place.

What You'll Be Doing

As a Senior Data Analyst, you'll play a key role in enhancing data-driven decision-making and uncovering analytics opportunities for growth within the Growth team and across business lines. Here's what your day-to-day will look like:


Deliver data-driven impact – By analyzing and implementing rigorous data-driven solutions that bring concrete value to the Growth team and other business lines, directly influencing strategic decisions and outcomes.
Analyze large datasets – To interpret complex information within large datasets, derive actionable insights, and support key decision-making processes across various departments through clear and concise analysis.
Design and manage experiments – By developing and overseeing A/B tests and other experiments to optimize product features and business processes, ensuring statistically significant results and providing clear recommendations.
Create data visualizations – To track key performance indicators (KPIs) and effectively communicate complex analytical insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through intuitive dashboards and comprehensive reports.
Collaborate and integrate data – By working closely with cross-functional teams (Product Marketing, CRM, Business Development, Engineering) to embed data insights into broader business strategies, ensuring data informs and shapes key initiatives.


Expect challenges, collaboration, and the freedom to bring your ideas to life. Things change quickly here, so be ready to adapt, take initiative, and shape your role as we grow.

Who We're Looking For

We need a problem-solver who loves teamwork and gets things done. If you're curious and ready for real ownership, you'll fit in! Does this sound like you?


Experience & Analytics – 5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics roles, with a strong foundation in analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills applied to real-world business challenges.
Programming Expertise – Advanced knowledge of SQL, including query optimization techniques for efficient data manipulation and retrieval from large databases, and extensive knowledge of Python or R for statistical modeling and advanced data analysis.
Visualization Tools – Proven experience with data visualization technologies such as Looker and Tableau (or similar tools), with the ability to create compelling and insightful dashboards and reports for diverse audiences.
Communication & Detail – Strong attention to detail in data analysis and reporting, coupled with the ability to communicate complex analytical insights effectively and convincingly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Language proficiency – Fluency in both Italian and English, enabling seamless communication within our international team and with stakeholders across different locations.


Don't worry if you don't tick every box. We believe in the power of different viewpoints and strengths. Your unique perspective is important as we build something special. If you're passionate and can make a difference, we truly encourage you to apply.

Our Benefits & Perks

We believe high commitment, effort, and impact deserve to be highly rewarded and supported. That’s why we created Satispay CareAbout, our way of making sure you’re supported in your well-being, growth, and finances:

👨‍👩‍👧 CareAbout health & well-being


Unlimited paid time off
Psychological support & mental health webinars with Serenis
Flexible hybrid working system
Extended parental leave
Childcare leave


📚 CareAbout growth & development


Professional development programmes
Internal mobility program
Language classes with Preply
Internal workshops & training


💰 CareAbout financial support


Stock Option Plan (with additional grants often provided based on performance)
International relocation support
Competitive salary
Flexible Benefit budget
Meal vouchers


Equal-Opportunity Employer

At Satispay, we're proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and inclusion, welcoming individuals of all backgrounds. This opportunity is open to everyone, regardless - for instance - of race, colour, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, and national origin. Join us in a workplace where everyone belongs!

Learn More About Us

Curious if our way of working clicks with yours? Our values and pillars aren’t just fancy words on a page - they really shape everything we do. Explore them here.

Sounds like your kind of place? Awesome!

We’d love to hear your story.


Show more

Title: Internship - Data Science
Description:
At ION

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.

What You Will Learn During Your Intern


Quantitative modelling of business processes
Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients –
Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive


What You Need To Know


Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
Fluent English


We Are Looking For Someone Who


is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work
Show more

Title: Intern Data Analyst & Supply Chain back-office support
Description:
Per nostra sede di Rho (MI) ricerchiamo un/a candidato/a da inserire in stage nel ruolo di: Intern Data Analyst & Supply Chain back-office support

La persona inserita in questo percorso formativo e professionalizzante avrà il compito di raccogliere, analizzare e interpretare dati complessi

relativi alla catena di approvvigionamento, al fine di identificare opportunità di miglioramento, ottimizzare i processi e supportare le decisioni strategiche.

Principali Attività e Responsabilità


Raccolta e gestione dei dati:


○ Estrarre e consolidare dati da diverse fonti (ERP, WMS, TMS, ecc.);

○ Assicurare l'accuratezza e l'integrità dei dati,

○ Sviluppare e mantenere database.


Analisi dei dati:


○ Identificare trend, pattern e anomalie nei dati;

○ Analisi dei KPI della supply chain(Key performance indicator) e sviluppare tools utili alla

gestione dei KPI stess;

○ Fornire analisi e raccomandazioni per ottimizzare i processi di

approvvigionamento,logistica e distribuzione

■ Fornire analisi e raccomandazioni da implementare per ottimizzare i processi di

approvvigionamento, produzione, logistica e distribuzione

■ Seguire il processo di ottimizzazione dei processi.


Implementazione delle azioni di miglioramento:


○ Gestire i progetti di implementazione delle azioni migliorative in linea con gli output delle

analisi;

○ Interfacciarsi con le funzioni interne e con l'HQ.


Reporting e visualizzazione:


○ Creare report e dashboard interattivi per comunicare i risultati delle analisi;

○ Presentare i risultati a stakeholder interni ed esterni.

Formazione

Laurea in Statistica, Matematica, Informatica, Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini.

Title: Data & Research Analyst
Description:
SAMY Alliance is a global network of marketing and communications agencies that combine research, technology, strategy, creativity, and performance to deliver impactful solutions, messages, and experiences. We are the first international ecosystem of independent agencies designed to provide top-tier, data-driven creative solutions for brands, with a shared focus on driving growth.


With over 500 employees across 14 offices in 15 countries, including Europe, the U.S., and Latin America, SAMY Alliance operates in 55 markets, serving more than 100 leading clients. We specialize in developing award-winning, end-to-end digital campaigns powered by data, strategy, and creativity.


We are looking for a Social Media Specialist to join our international team across Europe. Your role will involve balancing creative vision with operational efficiency, ensuring that all social media initiatives are executed on time, within budget, and to a high creative standard. You will also analyze results and optimize future campaigns based on insights to continuously improve our social media strategies.



Job functions:
Data Analysis & Insights:

Translate large volumes of data into concise, impactful insights.

Analyze metrics to evaluate campaign performance, identifying trends and areas for optimization.

Develop and maintain benchmarks to measure success against industry standards and competitors.

Track key social media metrics for Spain and provide concise, actionable insights in the monthly reports.

Performance Optimization: Offer recommendations based on data, helping the team make data-driven decisions to optimize content and engagement strategies.


Social Listening & Market Research:

Use social listening tools (e.g., Brandwatch, Sprinklr, Synthesio, NetBase, Socialbakers) to monitor consumer conversations, market trends, and competitor activity.

Conduct research to support account management and strategic planning teams with trend reports and market analysis.

Stay informed about the latest innovations and industry developments to guide strategy.


Reporting:

Prepare quarterly performance reports focused on brand performance, category trends, and competitive analysis.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create actionable recommendations that inform content creation, campaign messaging, and budget optimization.

Collaborate closely with the Account Manager and Social Media Manager to ensure reports align with overall campaign goals and deliver strategic value to the client.




Requirements

Required Skills:

2 years of experience overall

Ability to translate complex datasets into meaningful insights and impactful reports.

Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.

Highly collaborative with excellent communication and teamwork skills.

Proactive, curious, and innovative mindset.

Languages: Italian native, English full working proficiency (written and verbal)

Experience:

Proven experience in using social listening tools and analyzing data for marketing strategies (minimum 2-3 years).

Expertise in query setup, keyword selection, and crafting data-driven reports tailored to specific brand strategies.

Familiarity with digital marketing trends, social media platforms, and influencer marketing metrics.

Have work permit in Italy and live in Milan



Show more

About Us

Ipsos is one of the world’s largest research companies and currently the only one primarily managed by researchers, ranking as a #1 full-service research organization for four consecutive years . With over 75 different data-driven solutions, and presence in 90 markets, Ipsos brings together research, implementation, methodological, and subject-matter experts from around the world, combining thematic and technical experts to deliver top-quality research and insights. Title: Network Development Manager - Anywhere in India
Description:
Skills:
Network Expansion, Channel Management, Business Development, Market Analysis, Retail Operations, Sales Strategy,

Job Description

Position Title: NDM (Network Development Manager)

Department: Marketing and Sales

Business Unit: Fuel Retail

Job Grade: I

Locations: Anywhere in INDIA

About Company

Jio-bp is an Indian fuels and mobility joint venture between Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) and UK's bp plc. With the vision to become a solution provider of choice for mobility in India, the joint venture leverages Reliance's presence across 21 states and its millions of consumers through the Jio digital platform. bp brings its extensive global experience in high-quality differentiated fuels, lubricants, retail, and advanced low-carbon mobility solutions.

Job Accountabilities & Responsibilities


Network Expansion / Business Development
Evaluate and analyse un-represented / under-represented Markets to Identify potential business opportunities for setting up new sites
Monitoring new development, industrial & competitor expansion and analyse its impact on our existing network and also, assess new business opportunities.
Evaluate opportunities for Network Expansion/ Business Development in a defined geography.
Channel Partner management for identifying suitable channel partners with the desired real estate & investment capabilities for setting up new sites.
Develop sound / viable business options to enhance growth.
Monitor, and Track the progress of new sites spec release and take action in line with companies# objective
Network Planning
Monitoring network health through competitor benchmarking, to identify performance improvement opportunities and recommend business cases to facilitate decision
Analyse opportunities for optimization of operations by improving facilities at existing Retail Network
Initiate facility Augmentation proposals to improve operational efficiencies & customer service.
Program manage to secure suitable land parcels for setting up sites.
Stakeholder management to ensure timely completion of projects.
Handle site acquisition, lease surrender, and other related court cases to safeguard the companys interests.
Franchise Development
Monitor and Facilitate Channel partner selection with various stakeholders in line with the laid down process.
Evaluation and assessment of the financial and business acumen suitability of potential franchisees.
Generation of leads in accordance with the Market Area Plan and to ensure brand identity compliance


Education Requirement


B.E / B Tech
MBA Marketing Preferable
Background with Statistics would be an added advantage.


Experience Requirement


Minimum 5 years of Experience in Business / Network Development.
Exposure to Network planning and implementation would be an added advantage
Retail /Marketing / Channel sales in FMCG/ Consumer Durables/Automobile Industry

HTML:
Skills:
Network Expansion, Channel Management, Business Development, Market Analysis, Retail Operations, Sales Strategy,

Job Description

Position Title: NDM (Network Development Manager)

Department: Marketing and Sales

Business Unit: Fuel Retail

Job Grade: I

Locations: Anywhere in INDIA

About Company

Jio-bp is an Indian fuels and mobility joint venture between Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) and UK's bp plc. With the vision to become a solution provider of choice for mobility in India, the joint venture leverages Reliance's presence across 21 states and its millions of consumers through the Jio digital platform. bp brings its extensive global experience in high-quality differentiated fuels, lubricants, retail, and advanced low-carbon mobility solutions.

Job Accountabilities & Responsibilities

  • Network Expansion / Business Development
  • Evaluate and analyse un-represented / under-represented Markets to Identify potential business opportunities for setting up new sites
  • Monitoring new development, industrial & competitor expansion and analyse its impact on our existing network and also, assess new business opportunities.
  • Evaluate opportunities for Network Expansion/ Business Development in a defined geography.
  • Channel Partner management for identifying suitable channel partners with the desired real estate & investment capabilities for setting up new sites.
  • Develop sound / viable business options to enhance growth.
  • Monitor, and Track the progress of new sites spec release and take action in line with companies# objective
  • Network Planning
  • Monitoring network health through competitor benchmarking, to identify performance improvement opportunities and recommend business cases to facilitate decision
  • Analyse opportunities for optimization of operations by improving facilities at existing Retail Network
  • Initiate facility Augmentation proposals to improve operational efficiencies & customer service.
  • Program manage to secure suitable land parcels for setting up sites.
  • Stakeholder management to ensure timely completion of projects.
  • Handle site acquisition, lease surrender, and other related court cases to safeguard the companys interests.
  • Franchise Development
  • Monitor and Facilitate Channel partner selection with various stakeholders in line with the laid down process.
  • Evaluation and assessment of the financial and business acumen suitability of potential franchisees.
  • Generation of leads in accordance with the Market Area Plan and to ensure brand identity compliance

Education Requirement

  • B.E / B Tech
  • MBA Marketing Preferable
  • Background with Statistics would be an added advantage.

Experience Requirement

  • Minimum 5 years of Experience in Business / Network Development.
  • Exposure to Network planning and implementation would be an added advantage
  • Retail /Marketing / Channel sales in FMCG/ Consumer Durables/Automobile Industry

Title: Founder's Office Associate
Description:
About FoodNEST(S):




FoodNEST(S) is an innovative and fast-growing startup revolutionizing the AI landscape across businesses. As a dynamic and ambitious company, we are looking for a highly capable and proactive individual to join us in the Founder's Office.




Role: Founder’s Office Associate - Strategic Operations & Business Growth




Location : Lucknow

Stipend : 8000/month




Company provides: Food & Accommodation




The Founder's Office Associate will be the right hand to the founder, handling day-to-day operations, leading cross-functional teams, and ensuring seamless coordination across various departments. As part of the Founder’s Office, you will be at the centre of the company’s operations and most important priorities. You will work directly with the Founders to help manage day-to-day operations and strategic projects across Product, Marketing, Sales, Strategy and Business Operations.

We are looking for a highly strategic and execution-driven professional to join the Founder's Office and drive high-priority business initiatives. This role requires a mix of structured problem-solving, project ownership, and operational excellence. You will work across marketing, finance, business development, operations, and internal growth to ensure smooth execution, optimize workflows, and enable high-impact decision-making and tangible outcomes.




What you’ll do




Act as the central point of contact between the Founder and various internal & external stakeholders.
Take ownership of key business initiatives across multiple functions, including marketing, finance, client operations, and internal growth.
Break down complex challenges into clear execution roadmaps, ensuring seamless cross-team alignment.
Proactively assess risks and roadblocks, implementing preventive solutions before they escalate.
Create and manage performance dashboards to track project progress, optimize workflows, and improve operational efficiency.
Manage daily operations and ensure smooth execution of strategic priorities.
Work closely with teams to maintain high execution quality, delegating effectively while ensuring accountability.
Manage and engage cross-functional teams across Engineering, Sales, Marketing, and Operations.
Lead cross-functional collaboration, ensuring projects are delivered without micromanagement.
Monitor KPIs, work quality, and feedback loops to refine internal processes continuously.
Support team dynamics and culture, ensuring smooth people operations and workflow stability.
Identify inefficiencies in CRM, project management tools, and performance tracking systems.
Implement automation and digital solutions to streamline repetitive tasks and improve execution speed.
Ensure smooth invoicing, financial workflows, and budget adherence where needed.
Serve as the stabilizing force when unexpected challenges arise, maintaining operational clarity.
Compartmentalize and prioritize effectively, focusing on high-value tasks.
Make strategic decisions on resource allocation, ensuring time and company resources are optimized.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships with leaders and a complex set of stakeholders, to drive organizational change
Assist in decision-making processes by providing insights, research, and analysis.
Negotiate and communicate effectively with vendors, partners, and other external stakeholders.
Handle critical escalations and conflict resolution both internally and externally.
Maintain a strong executive presence with impression-creating physical attributes.
Work closely with the Founder on strategic initiatives and business expansion.
Ensure flexibility in work hours as per startup demands.
Should be willing to take up external meetings with customers, stakeholders across the country and city.




Who We're Looking For:




Structured Deep Thinker: You break down complex problems into actionable steps.
Highly Proactive & Solutions-Driven: You anticipate challenges and solve problems before they escalate.
Strong Delegation & Leadership: You drive execution by ensuring the right people get things done.
Strong communication and negotiation skills esp. with customers, leadership, stakeholders etc.
Help drive key priorities of the Founders’ by program managing & coordinating with leaders across the organisation; acting as gatekeepers and ensuring the Founders’ involvement in a project or decision-making process at the right moment
High Emotional Intelligence (EQ): You navigate teams, stakeholders, and high-pressure situations with clarity. High problem-solving aptitude with a proactive mindset.
Exceptional interpersonal skills with a dynamic and engaging personality.
Tech-Savvy & Automation-Oriented: You are comfortable with CRM, project management tools, cloud products such as google suite and financial dashboards.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, evolving startup environment.
Thrives Under Pressure: You stay calm, focused, and effective in fast-paced, high-stakes environments.
Comfort with data analytics, automation, and digital tools.
Should exhibit exception skill of managing teams, driving execution, and overseeing high-impact projects.
Acting as a versatile problem solver and team player who can get involved across different projects to drive key business outcomes on the Founders’ behalf
Acting as the sounding board for ideas and initiatives; helping the Founders identify the areas where to direct his focus
Managing time: working with the founder, managing the long-term travel calendar, meeting calendar, daily activity calendar valuating opportunities and determining fit with priorities
Helping the Founders draft internal and external communications (board meetings, company announcements & notifications, newsletters, reports, pitch decks, speeches and presentations)
Ability to communicate and delegate effectively across all levels
Excellent proficiency in English and Hindi.
Willingness to travel as required.

Experience: 1-3 years in business operations, consulting, finance, or strategic execution roles.




Why Join Us?

Work closely with the Founder and leadership team.
High-growth opportunities in a fast-paced start-up environment.
Exposure to multiple business functions and industry networks.
A well-sought career trajectory right directly to the leadership levels.
A challenging yet rewarding role that shapes your future with FoodNEST(S)




If this vibes and motivates you to do some real impactful work that shapes not just your career but your life's perspective, then mail your resumes at careers@foodnests.com. We will be looking out for the right people to join our tribe and create some noise in the space of AI products.

Title: Associate Professor
Company: Hind Institute of Medical Sciences & Hospital
Description:
Role Summary:

The Associate Professor in Anatomy is responsible for delivering high-quality education in human anatomy to undergraduate (MBBS) and postgraduate students, conducting research, guiding junior faculty and students, and contributing to academic administration and curriculum development.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Teaching & Academic Duties

Conduct theory and practical classes in Gross Anatomy, Embryology, Histology, and Neuroanatomy.
Supervise and assess cadaver dissection and microscopic slide sessions.
Use modern teaching methodologies (PPTs, models, digital tools).
Mentor undergraduate and postgraduate students in academic and research activities.
Prepare and evaluate internal assessment and university examination papers.

2. Research and Publications

Conduct independent and collaborative research in the field of anatomy.
Guide postgraduate and Ph.D. students in their thesis/dissertation work.
Publish regularly in indexed national and international medical journals.
Apply for grants and research projects as per institutional policy.

3. Administrative and Departmental Roles

Assist the Head of Department (HOD) in managing departmental activities and compliance.
Maintain records as per NMC guidelines, including logbooks, attendance, and practical evaluations.
Coordinate with the Anatomy Museum and Dissection Hall for upkeep and innovation.
Participate in curriculum development and academic audits.

4. Ethical and Professional Conduct

Adhere to the highest standards of ethics in teaching and research.
Engage in continuous medical education (CME) and professional development programs.
Foster a positive and inclusive academic environment.

Qualifications:

Essential: MBBS + MD in Anatomy from an NMC-recognized institution.
Experience: Minimum of 5 years teaching experience, including 4 years as Assistant Professor (as per NMC norms).
Desirable: Publications in indexed journals; experience with modern teaching tools and research methodologies.

Skills & Competencies:

Strong command over anatomical sciences.
Effective teaching and communication skills.
Research aptitude and academic leadership.
Familiarity with NMC norms and academic accreditation standards.
Ability to handle cadavers and anatomical specimens with sensitivity and professionalism.

Title: General Administrator
Description:
Key Responsibilities

Project Phase Responsibilities:

Support in infrastructure planning, office setup, and procurement of essential

resources.

Liaise with contractors, consultants, and project teams to support smooth

execution of site development.

Manage temporary site offices, security, and logistics for project staff.

Ensure adherence to statutory requirements, environmental clearances, and

safety norms during the project phase.

Help with administrative onboarding of key personnel during the project

phase.

General Administration

Oversee day-to-day administrative operations at the plant.

Ensure proper upkeep and maintenance of office buildings, plant

infrastructure, and utilities.

Implement and monitor administrative policies, procedures, and best

practices.

Facility amp; Security Management:

Supervise security, housekeeping, and maintenance teams to ensure a safe

and secure work environment.

Implement security measures, surveillance, and emergency response

protocols.

Coordinate with external agencies for fire safety, disaster management, and

crisis handling.

Statutory Compliance And Liaison

Ensure compliance with local regulations, labour laws, and statutory

requirements.

Help Liaise with government authorities for approvals, licensing, and audits.

Vendor Contract Management

Oversee procurement and vendor management for administrative supplies

and services.

Negotiate contracts with service providers, security agencies, housekeeping,

and maintenance teams.

Title: Human Resources Executive
Description:
Exciting Job Opportunity at HCLTECH




Job Brief:




We require a person with excellent communication skills and peoples’ skills. The person should be able to maintain confidentiality.

The person would be responsible for managing the Induction, Scholar Connects, Engagement sessions and Events, Performance discussions, Scholars’ Conduct and behavioral issues, front end for Grievance redressal, address queries and manage Exit requests and actions.




Responsibilities:




Induction:




Informing candidates regarding the start of Training
Scheduling and conducting HR Induction and Parental Connect, during the start of Training
Introduction to the organization, Overview of the processes and policies, session to clarify candidate and parental queries
Conducting regular Batch Connects, Engagement sessions and Performance related discussions. Updating all the details on the application tools for the below:
Regular Batch Connects as per the Batch Calendar
Regular Engagement sessions and events as per the Engagement Calendar
Performance related coaching and Scholar discussions as and when referred by Training Team
Parental discussions and Parental Undertaking before Final re-assessment
Addressing Scholar grievances within SLA and respond to query tickets within SLA
Internship Induction to socialize the Scholars regarding Internship Phase, organizational and professional requirements, addressing any concerns and queries
Exit discussions with focus on Retention discussions for Voluntary exits
Supporting Scholars during their training process by:
Scheduling and completing all required discussions within stipulated SLAs.
Understanding the actual situation and root causes, identify behavioral patterns which might be potential deterrents.
Facilitating Scholars to develop self-awareness and help them understand how to enhance their performance




Requirements:




Candidate should be based at Lucknow, or be willing to relocate and work only from Lucknow
Good communication skills in English and Hindi
Flexibility and willingness to work in a dynamic working environment
Willingness and enthusiasm for learning and growth
Basic Computer skills
Willingness to take initiative
Work experience of 2-5 years




Interested Candidate can share their resumes at emanuel.vijay@hcltech.com with subject line “Job Application for Scholar HR Partner Lucknow"

Title: Investigator
Description:
Ethos Risk Services is continuing to expand our team of Private Field Surveillance Investigators!

We are looking for Experienced Licensed Investigators in the Las Vegas, NV area to investigate fraud and conduct covert surveillance in the field (from your vehicle).

Ethos Risk is one of the largest and most respected fraud investigations businesses in the US. Join us in uncovering the facts, keeping insurance costs from rising, and serving our clients in a fully remote position.

Are you ready to join the best fraud investigation company in the industry? Apply now!

Ethos Risk Services: What drives us

At Ethos, you'll find more than just a job - you'll discover a purposeful career where your contributions make a lasting impact. Join us and become a trusted partner in insurance claims management and fraud investigations, delivering certainty and peace of mind to every client we serve.

What does aN Experienced FIELD Surveillance Investigator do?

As a Surveillance Investigator at Ethos Risk Services, you will conduct covert surveillance, review files, and draft detailed case reports. Working autonomously from your vehicle, you will capture video evidence of surveillance targets, collaborate with our Operations Managers, and ultimately improve the integrity of the health care and insurance industry. Join a team that celebrates high performers, values employees, and delivers results.

What You Need To Be Successful

To qualify for this position candidates must possess:


A valid private investigator license
A valid driver's license
A well-maintained / reliable vehicle (preferably with tinted windows)


In this role you will use discretion, communicate with our Operations Managers regularly, and apply critical thinking skills while conducting surveillance and gathering evidence. Adaptability, attention to detail, and strong analytical capabilities are essential qualities for success at Ethos.

Candidates who are self-motivated, resourceful, and able to maintain a high level of professionalism in various situations will thrive in this position.

Work Schedule

Most investigations will begin at 6AM and may require you to leave your home between 4-5AM. Candidates who are willing to work most weekends and holidays will be prioritized in the hiring process.

Make your move

If you think this position is a fit for what you are looking for, applying is a snap - just follow the instructions on this page. Good luck!

Ethos Risk Services is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate on the basis of religious creed, sex, national origin, race, veteran status, disability, age, marital status, color or sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law.

A background check will be conducted, in accordance to the local state law and regulations.

Salary: $28 - $38 per hour

Job Posted by ApplicantPro
