Title: Data Analyst 80 - 100 %
Description:
Luzern

unbefristet

Eine Laufbahn im Stab Innovation bei der Suva ist weit mehr als eine sichere Arbeitsstelle. Bei uns arbeitest du mit agilen Methoden (Scrum/SAFe) und übernimmst Verantwortung für wirkungsvolle User Stories. Und du treibst mit unseren IT-Systemen und Applikationen die Digitalisierung für den Werkplatz Schweiz voran. Damit leistest du einen wichtigen Beitrag zur Sicherheit und Gesundheit der Schweiz bei Arbeit und Freizeit. Lass dich überraschen und entwickle dich mit uns.

Was du bewegst


Als Teil eines agilen Teams aus Data Analysts und Business Analysts arbeitest du im Stabsbereich Innovation an der Weiterentwicklung unserer Produkte in den Bereichen Datenanalyse und Reporting mit.
Du bist verantwortlich für die Bearbeitung von Anfragen zu Analysen auf unseren Datenquellen. Dafür berätst du unsere fachlichen Teams, erhebst die Daten, bereitest sie auf und kommunizierst die Ergebnisse.
Gemeinsam mit unseren fachlichen Kunden entwickelst du Lösungen im Power BI und erhebst dazu die Anforderungen.
Zu deinem Aufgabengebiet gehören die regelmässige Erstellung von Kennzahlenreportings für die Prozesse sowie die Kommunikation der Ergebnisse im Schadenmanagement.
Du hast die Möglichkeit, dich im professionellen Umfeld von analytischen Applikationen weiterzuentwickeln.



Was wir erwarten


Du verfügst über Programmierkenntnisse in SQL und Erfahrung im Umgang mit Datenbanken. Dich zeichnet ein gutes Gespür für Datenqualität sowie vertiefte Erfahrung im Bereich Datenanalyse aus. (Python, R oder ähnliche Programmiersprachen sind von Vorteil)
Erfahrung mit Visualisierungslösungen und Dashboard-Tools wie Power BI, Tableau oder ähnlichen Tools befähigen dich optimal für diese Rolle.
Von Vorteil sind Berufserfahrung im Versicherungsumfeld sowie Kenntnisse von Syrius, unserer Kernapplikation im Schadenmanagement.
Sehr gute analytisch-konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten mit Umsetzungsstärke und einer strukturierten Vorgehensweise zeichnen dich aus.
Gute Deutschkenntnisse sind für die Kommunikation mit fachlichen Stakeholdern eine Voraussetzung.



Was uns auszeichnet


Life-Balance ist uns wichtig. Deshalb bieten wir moderne Arbeitszeitmodelle und zentrumsnahe Standorte.
Wir leben Wertschätzung und ein unkompliziertes und kollegiales Miteinander.
Bei uns gibt es viele abwechslungsreiche Arbeitsinhalte mit hohem Gestaltungsspielraum.
Bei der Suva arbeiten macht und stiftet Sinn.



Wer sich auf dich freut

Nico Joller

Talent Acquisition Manager

041 419 5843
Show more
HTML:
Luzern

unbefristet

Eine Laufbahn im Stab Innovation bei der Suva ist weit mehr als eine sichere Arbeitsstelle. Bei uns arbeitest du mit agilen Methoden (Scrum/SAFe) und übernimmst Verantwortung für wirkungsvolle User Stories. Und du treibst mit unseren IT-Systemen und Applikationen die Digitalisierung für den Werkplatz Schweiz voran. Damit leistest du einen wichtigen Beitrag zur Sicherheit und Gesundheit der Schweiz bei Arbeit und Freizeit. Lass dich überraschen und entwickle dich mit uns.

Was du bewegst

  • Als Teil eines agilen Teams aus Data Analysts und Business Analysts arbeitest du im Stabsbereich Innovation an der Weiterentwicklung unserer Produkte in den Bereichen Datenanalyse und Reporting mit.
  • Du bist verantwortlich für die Bearbeitung von Anfragen zu Analysen auf unseren Datenquellen. Dafür berätst du unsere fachlichen Teams, erhebst die Daten, bereitest sie auf und kommunizierst die Ergebnisse.
  • Gemeinsam mit unseren fachlichen Kunden entwickelst du Lösungen im Power BI und erhebst dazu die Anforderungen.
  • Zu deinem Aufgabengebiet gehören die regelmässige Erstellung von Kennzahlenreportings für die Prozesse sowie die Kommunikation der Ergebnisse im Schadenmanagement.
  • Du hast die Möglichkeit, dich im professionellen Umfeld von analytischen Applikationen weiterzuentwickeln.


Was wir erwarten

  • Du verfügst über Programmierkenntnisse in SQL und Erfahrung im Umgang mit Datenbanken. Dich zeichnet ein gutes Gespür für Datenqualität sowie vertiefte Erfahrung im Bereich Datenanalyse aus. (Python, R oder ähnliche Programmiersprachen sind von Vorteil)
  • Erfahrung mit Visualisierungslösungen und Dashboard-Tools wie Power BI, Tableau oder ähnlichen Tools befähigen dich optimal für diese Rolle.
  • Von Vorteil sind Berufserfahrung im Versicherungsumfeld sowie Kenntnisse von Syrius, unserer Kernapplikation im Schadenmanagement.
  • Sehr gute analytisch-konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten mit Umsetzungsstärke und einer strukturierten Vorgehensweise zeichnen dich aus.
  • Gute Deutschkenntnisse sind für die Kommunikation mit fachlichen Stakeholdern eine Voraussetzung.


Was uns auszeichnet

  • Life-Balance ist uns wichtig. Deshalb bieten wir moderne Arbeitszeitmodelle und zentrumsnahe Standorte.
  • Wir leben Wertschätzung und ein unkompliziertes und kollegiales Miteinander.
  • Bei uns gibt es viele abwechslungsreiche Arbeitsinhalte mit hohem Gestaltungsspielraum.
  • Bei der Suva arbeiten macht und stiftet Sinn.


Wer sich auf dich freut

Nico Joller

Talent Acquisition Manager

041 419 5843

Title: Pricing & Data Analyst (m/w/d) - Pensum 50%
Description:
Du suchst eine spannende Herausforderung in einem dynamischen, europaweit führenden Unternehmen? Du hast bereits Erfahrung im Umgang mit Datenmodellen gesammelt und möchtest deine analytischen Fähigkeiten und dein technisches Verständnis gewinnbringend einsetzen? Effizienz und strukturierte Arbeitsweise sind für dich selbstverständlich und du möchtest deine Stärken in einem engagierten Team entfalten?

Dann bist du bei uns als




Pricing & Data Analyst (m/w/d) - Pensum 50%




genau richtig! Als europaweit führendes Multikanalvertriebsunternehmen im Bau- und Kfz-Handwerk sowie in der Industrie bieten wir dir die Möglichkeit, Verantwortung zu übernehmen und die Zukunft aktiv mitzugestalten.

Werde Teil eines traditionsreichen Familienunternehmens, das Innovation grossschreibt und Kundenorientierung lebt. Gemeinsam arbeiten wir an wegweisenden Lösungen und schaffen nachhaltigen Mehrwert – für unsere Kunden, für dich und für die Zukunft.

Was dich erwartet

Regelmässiges Reporting und Ad hoc Analysen für Marketing & Vertrieb
Aufbereiten grosser Datenmengen
Selbstständige Weiterentwicklung der Reporting-Landschaft
Laufende Preis-, Konditions- und Provisionsspeicherungen in SAP inkl. Datenaufbereitung
Erstellen von Kunden- und Umsatzlisten sowie Verkaufshistorien
Pricing-Restrukturierung: Preiskalkulation & Konditionsmanagement
Abweichungsanalysen (Plan-Ist)
Auswertungen und Analyse von Sonderprojekten inkl. Aufbereitung der Daten




Was dich auszeichnet

Abgeschlossene kaufmännische Ausbildung oder betriebswirtschaftliches Studium
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im (Marketing-/Vertriebs-) Controlling
Technisches und analytisches Verständnis
Umfangreiche IT-Kenntnisse (SAP, MS Office)
Offenheit und Kommunikationsfähigkeit zählen zu deinen Stärken
Du arbeitest gerne selbstständig und strukturiert, hast eine rasche Auffassungsgabe und verfügst über eine ausgeprägte analytische Denkweise
Eine gewissenhafte und exakte Arbeitsweise ist für dich selbstverständlich
Du kommunizierst auf Deutsch, Englisch und Französisch




Was wir bieten

Die Werte und Nachhaltigkeit eines Familienunternehmens. Gleichzeitig stellen wir uns heute für die Zukunft auf: Kundenzufriedenheit und Digitalisierung stehen dabei für uns stark im Vordergrund. Werde Teil dieses einzigartigen Wandlungsprozesses und ebne mit deiner erfolgreichen Arbeit den Weg für deine und unsere Weiterentwicklung.




Wer wir sind

165 Mitarbeiter und Mitarbeiterinnen schweizweit. Über 36.000 Artikel für das Bau- und Kfz-Handwerk. Professionelle Beratung und individueller Service mit über 50 Jahren Erfahrung. Kurzum: ein führendes Multikanalvertriebsunternehmen. So viel zu den reinen Fakten. Aber hinter der Marke BERNER steckt etwas noch viel Wertvolleres: ein Familienunternehmen mit ebenso viel Herz wie Verstand.

Wir freuen uns auf deine detaillierte Bewerbung (Lebenslauf mit Foto, Zeugnisse und Arbeitszeugnisse) mit Lohnvorstellung, bevorzugt per E-Mail an: jobs.berner-ch@berner-ag.ch

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech’s invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton’s services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here! Check our social media pages to learn more about us: Twitter, Reddit, Instagram.

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented Marketing Data Analyst to support data-driven decision-making in the Marketing department. You will be embedded within the marketing team and play a key role in understanding customer behaviour, guiding marketing initiatives, and analysing our landing experience flow, A/B tests, etc. Your insights will directly influence strategies, helping the team optimise marketing efforts. You will be part of the Marketing team, but you will also collaborate with the Data team, which consists of data science, data analytics and data engineering to continuously enhance your data platform, reporting tools and statistical techniques.

This role requires good knowledge of A/B testing and user funnels for landing page optimisation, combined with the ability to create actionable insights for Marketing & cross-functional teams. You will work closely with growth, performance marketing, data and product teams to drive better decision-making through data-driven strategies

What You Will Do



Analyse user funnels and A/B tests to reveal insights that guide and optimise our landing pages and overall user flow up to and including the checkout.
Be the point of contact for all analytical consultation on landing page optimisation - including test set up, logging specification, sample size estimation and hypothesis formulation.
Regularly monitor data to identify trends and anomalies to enhance the user experience.
Develop and maintain dashboards in Metabase and our privacy first inhouse tool to provide Marketing and Growth teams with clear and actionable insights.
Build data pipelines processing data from several sources to compute KPIs.
Collaborate closely with the data team to improve our analytics infrastructure
Proactively communicate your conclusions and educate stakeholders on interpreting results.
Develop training programs to elevate data literacy within the marketing team.



Job Requirements



Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (marketing, statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science, etc.).
At least 4 years of relevant working experience with a focus on statistics, data exploration and visualisation.
Solid knowledge and practical experience in A/B testing.
Strong analytical mindset with the ability to draw actionable insights
Good knowledge of data querying and transformation using SQL
Clear communication skills with the ability to tailor messages to technical and non-technical stakeholders.



Bonus points for:



Experience in high-growth, global technology companies
Familiarity with subscription-based and freemium business models.
Good knowledge of other programming languages such as Python.



What We Offer



Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton’s only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.



Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Nous ouvrons un poste de Data Analyst pour renforcer les équipes de notre client à Genève.




Responsabilités

Réaliser une cartographie des données actuelles (AS-IS) des principaux systèmes en lien avec l’employabilité.
Identifier les sources de données, les référentiels utilisés, les types de données manipulées (qualitatives, quantitatives, sensibles).
Participer à la définition du modèle de données cible (TO-BE) aligné avec les objectifs métiers.
Intégrer des modèles sémantiques et ontologies existantes sur l’employabilité et le marché du travail (ESCO, EURES, etc.).
Contribuer à l’interopérabilité des modèles de données internes et externes
Cartographier les flux de données
Documenter les flux de données existants (AS-IS) entre applications et entités administratives.
Proposer une vision cible cohérente des flux inter-systèmes dans une logique de simplification et d’urbanisation.
Contribuer à la rédaction du Plan Directeur Data
Participer activement à la structuration du plan directeur sur les volets data.
Mettre en évidence les besoins, lacunes et recommandations concrètes pour l’évolution du SI sur les aspects data.
Collaborer avec les architectes d’entreprise, les data stewards, les responsables métiers et les autres analystes.
Organiser, animer ou contribuer à des ateliers inter-offices afin de collecter les informations nécessaires




Qualifications

Expérience confirmée (3–5 ans minimum) en analyse de données, modélisation de données ou architecture data dans un environnement complexe.
Maîtrise des outils de modélisation et de cartographie (Enterprise Architect, Lucidchart, Power BI, Excel avancé...).
Connaissance des principes d’ontologies, modélisation sémantique (RDF, OWL) et utilisation de modèles européens (ESCO, LOM, etc.).
Expérience en interopérabilité des données, interopérabilité sémantique, exploitation de données ouvertes (Open Data) et intégration de sources externes.
Maîtrise des concepts de gouvernance de la donnée, modèles de qualité, métadonnées, référentiels.
Excellentes capacités rédactionnelles et de synthèse, à l’aise dans la communication interinstitutionnelle.
Expérience dans un contexte public appréciée




Rejoindre Sword, c’est…

💼 Formation continue : Un budget formation qui croit tous les mois à utiliser dans un large catalogue de formation

🏝 25 jours de congés payés : Tous nos employés ont droit à 25 jours de congés payés par an

🤹‍ Respect de la vie privée : Chez nous, pas de réunions après 17 heures

🚑 Une couverture assurance-accident internationale

🎉 Evènements réguliers : Des événements mensuels pour se retrouver en petit ou grand comité

🌍 Environnements internationaux : Des missions dans des groupes d'envergure internationale

🛠 Innovation : Contribuez à des projets impactants et innovants dans de nombreux secteurs d'activité

🎁 Des petits plaisirs : Nos employés bénéficient d'un programme d'avantages et remises très intéressantes

  • Connaissance des principes d’ontologies, modélisation sémantique (RDF, OWL) et utilisation de modèles européens (ESCO, LOM, etc.).
  • Expérience en interopérabilité des données, interopérabilité sémantique, exploitation de données ouvertes (Open Data) et intégration de sources externes.
  • Maîtrise des concepts de gouvernance de la donnée, modèles de qualité, métadonnées, référentiels.
  • Excellentes capacités rédactionnelles et de synthèse, à l’aise dans la communication interinstitutionnelle.
  • Expérience dans un contexte public appréciée


Rejoindre Sword, c’est…

💼 Formation continue : Un budget formation qui croit tous les mois à utiliser dans un large catalogue de formation

🏝 25 jours de congés payés : Tous nos employés ont droit à 25 jours de congés payés par an

🤹‍ Respect de la vie privée : Chez nous, pas de réunions après 17 heures

🚑 Une couverture assurance-accident internationale

🎉 Evènements réguliers : Des événements mensuels pour se retrouver en petit ou grand comité

🌍 Environnements internationaux : Des missions dans des groupes d'envergure internationale

🛠 Innovation : Contribuez à des projets impactants et innovants dans de nombreux secteurs d'activité

🎁 Des petits plaisirs : Nos employés bénéficient d'un programme d'avantages et remises très intéressantes

Title: Junior Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Swissblock Technologies

Swissblock Technologies is a private investment firm dedicated to pioneering cryptocurrency integration with cross-asset investing. Applying a quantitative view to financial markets, we manage systematic multi-strategy portfolios of digital and traditional assets.




Our Systematic Crypto Group transforms market insights into robust algorithmic investment strategies, trading fully automated on our prop trading infrastructure. We are dedicated to a collaborative, non-siloed environment with shared incentives, where each member can directly shape the team’s and company's future.




This role can based from anywhere in Switzerland.




Responsibilities and Objectives

Quantitative Researchers in our Systematic Crypto Group have the opportunity to drive the research process from ideation to final implementation, ultimately specialising according to individual strengths and preferences. This will involve to

Analyse the crypto ecosystems to uncover the fundamental dynamics that drive price and risk formation.
Utilise advanced statistical techniques on both traditional and crypto-specific data sets.
Conceptualised and enhanced monetisation systems for trading signals and other market anomalies.
Implement, backtest, and deploy algorithmic trading strategies within a live trading environment.
Monitor live strategy performance and integrate insights into the research loop.
Participate in the development of our research agenda based on research findings and ideas.




Skills and Talents

Advanced degree in a highly quantitative field.
Excellent analytical skills with strong attention to detail; ability to maintain a pragmatic mindset.
Passion for traditional and crypto markets; driven to model the underlying market dynamics.
Ability to conduct data-driven research focused on solving real-world problems.
Dedication to continuous learning and making an impact; willingness to question the status quo.
Ability to effectively summarise and clearly communicate research results.
Prior exposure to quantitative research (preferably in digital assets).
Proficiency in Python and experience in using statistical packages.




Culture

Swissblock Technologies offers an exciting and diverse environment with flat hierarchies and excellent peers. We are a profitable company with a culture based on responsibility and merit. Empowerment of each individual team member is a key value reflected in our career dynamics, which continuously grow with the business.




In addition to a modern office in Baar, Switzerland – flexibility to work remotely within Switzerland – we propose a competitive compensation package, an annual bonus, 25 days of annual leave, progressive social benefits, and engaging company events.

Show more

Title: Student (m/f/d) Data Analyst 40%
Description:
At Endress+Hauser, progress happens by working together. As the global leader in measurement instrumentation, our ~17.000 employees shape the future in the field of process automation. Whether developing and realizing new technology as a team, collaborating to build instrumentation, or strengthening vital relationships with countless global industries, we work to create trusted relationships that help everyone thrive. As a family-owned company, we look beyond short-term moves and work to create a vision that is forward-thinking for our people, our clients, and the world at large.   

We are looking for a Student (m/f/d) Data Analyst with 40% workload to join our Group and and contribute to our cross-functional project team. The position is located in Reinach, BL, Switzerland.

What is the role about? 

Are you passionate about data analysis and creating solutions that drive business decisions? Do you enjoy working collaboratively in a dynamic team environment? Are you eager to take on challenges and make an impact through your work? If so, you are the type of person who would excel in our Student (m/f/d) Data Analyst role. Join us in leveraging data to optimize our demand planning processes, contributing to the success of our integrated business planning initiatives.

Which tasks will you perform? 


You will analyze data as a member if the Integrated Business Planning Data Team, contributing to informed decision making
You will autonomously find solutions to given tasks regarding data analysis, demonstrating resourcefulness and initiative
You will develop diagrams to visually represent complex data sets and analysis results
You will interpret and document data analysis results, providing clear insights for stakeholders


What do we expect from you?  


Enrolled student
Advanced statistics knowledge
Experience with business warehouse (bw) and business application programming (bap)
Advanced knowledge of Excel, including SAP Analysis for Microsoft Office Plug-in
Collaborating effectively within cross-functional teams
Knowledge of demand planning and analysis of market-related figures is an advantage


What can you expect from us? 


We are a family-owned, highly committed company with a sustainable vision.
We prioritize Work-Life Balance, offering flexible working hours and remote work opportunities to support our employees in maintaining a healthy balance.
We promote lifelong learning with versatile training and further education opportunities, internal knowledge transfer and e-learning.  


How do you apply?

To apply we kindly ask you to upload your documents on our career page.

Applications sent to us by E-Mail cannot unfortunately be considered due to Data Privacy considerations.

Agencies, HR service providers, or similar entities are kindly requested to refrain from unsolicited submission of profiles and inquiries regarding potential collaboration. Currently, we do not engage with external service providers for this role. Any unsolicited applications will be disregarded and deleted without further consideration. We appreciate your understanding.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst junior Excel & VBA à 80/100% !
Description:
Tu es titulaire d'une formation ou d'une première expérience en tant que data analyst ? Tu es très à l'aise avec les outils Excel et VBA ? Tu es disponible immédiatement à 80/100% et tu cherches un poste à long terme ? Alors cette offre est faite pour toi !







A propos du rôle

Notre client, Notre client, une association genevoise qui se charge de la gestion des fonds de prévoyance est à la recherche d'un.e data analyst pour aider intégrer leur équipe à long terme. Tu travailleras en collaboration directe avec les équipes IT et métiers où tu seras en charge de gérer les données de la structure ainsi que d'en vérifier la qualité. En cas de besoin, tu collaboreras avec les différentes équipes pour la résolution des problèmes et l'amélioration de la qualité des données !




Tâches

Analyser les données transmises avec Excel et VBA
Vérifier la qualité et le format des données
Communiquer avec les équipes IT et métiers pour gérer les problématiques rencontrées




Nous cherchons

Tu possèdes une formation ou une première expérience en tant que data analyst
Tu es très à l'aise avec les outils Excel et VBA
Tu es disponible à hauteur de 80 ou 100% et tu recherches une offre à long terme




Mais surtout, tu es une personne dotée d'un esprit analytique, d'un excellent relationnel et organisée dans son travail. Cette description te correspond ? Alors postule !

Title: Data analyst - 80% à 100%
Description:
Description De L'entreprise

Avec plus de 12'000 collaborateurs représentant 160 métiers, les Hôpitaux Universitaires de Genève sont un établissement de référence au niveau national et international. Pour en savoir plus sur notre institution, prenez quelques minutes pour consulter notre rétrospective 2024 en cliquant ici.

Le Département de chirurgie assure la prise en charge des patientes et patients, à la fois en électif et en urgence. Il représente un centre d'excellence, non seulement helvétique, mais également européen dans plusieurs domaines et dans plusieurs de ses spécialités chirurgicales.

Le Département de chirurgie accueille chaque année des dizaines de visiteuses et visiteurs extérieurs venus faire un stage de perfectionnement. Avec 8 spécialités chirurgicales, il emploie environ 900 collaborateurs et collaboratrices pour un volume d'activité de près de 200 MCHF.

Les huit services médicaux qu'il regroupe fonctionnent de manière autonome pour les soins aux patients et patientes. Ils restent liés fonctionnellement et structurellement en matière : de budget, d'enseignement, de formation et d'activités académiques, ﻿﻿de partage de blocs opératoires, de prise en charge des urgences chirurgicales et ﻿﻿d'activités liées à la chirurgie humanitaire et le budget commun départemental.

Description Du Poste

Dans le cadre de vos fonctions, vous comprenez, évaluez les données médicales, et suivez leur évolution pour répondre aux besoins des parties prenantes en tenant compte de l’existant, de l’organisation et des enjeux du département, de la DTN-IA, et en vous inscrivant dans les valeurs de l’institution.

Vous participez à l’élaboration de la stratégie des données du département en alignement avec la stratégie institutionnelle et êtes force de proposition. Dans ce cadre, vous procédez à un état des lieux des besoins, des processus et des outils existants.

Vous collaborez étroitement avec les data managers du département et les soutenez activement dans leur activité de collecte et de saisies de données en mettant en place des processus automatisés.

Vous gérez les registres du département, les API permettant de les consulter et avez une expérience de gestion de registres avec des solutions tels que REDCap et File Maker. Vous concevez, répondez aux logbooks institutionnels, aux exigences MHS et fédérales en matière de gestion de données et des registres.

Vous anticipez et appréhendez les évolutions informatiques. Vous avez une expérience de gestion de bases de données. Vous procédez à leur mise à jour et à l’uniformisation des formulaires et des pratiques existantes au sein du département et de chaque service en fonction des besoins. Vous avez une expérience dans la construction de Dashboard avec des outils tel que QlikSense ou équivalent.

Vous représentez le domaine dans le cadre des échanges et coordinations. Vous assumez, de façon autonome, la responsabilité de projets informatiques pluridisciplinaires et transverses. Vous évaluez de nouvelles solutions dans le cadre du domaine fonctionnel ou technique qui vous est confié et assurez le rôle de conseiller-ère technique auprès du service.

Vous inspirez la stratégie d’utilisation et la mise en place de solutions informatiques. Vous concevez ou développez des applications informatiques, évaluez les coûts, les avantages et les contraintes de chaque solution. Vous concevez, documentez et déroulez une feuille de route pour chaque solution sous votre responsabilité.

Qualifications

Au bénéfice d’un Master en informatique ou diplôme jugé équivalent.

Vous avez minimum 5 ans d’expérience dans une fonction similaire. Vous êtes à jour en relation avec les techniques et outils d’intégration et de déploiement continus. Vous êtes à même de gérer des projets et faites preuve d’une capacité d’analyse fonctionnelle.

Vous excellez dans le développement logiciel en équipe et dans des environnements complexes. Vous êtes également apte à faire des tests logiciels.

Vous possédez un esprit analytique avec une bonne résistance au stress. Vous êtes capable de travailler efficacement en équipe tout en alliant l’aspect technique et métier. Vous faites preuve d’un intérêt pour le monde hospitalier.

Informations supplémentaires

Horaires réguliers, travail de week-end, travail de nuit, piquets en fonction des besoins du service


Entrée en fonction : Dès que possible
Nombre de poste : 1
Taux d’activité : 80% à 100%
Classe de fonction : 20
Type de contrat : CDI
Délai de candidature : 13.06.2025
Demande de renseignement : Mme C. Rosset, responsable administrative et financière, tél 022 372 77 70


Votre dossier de candidature doit comporter une lettre démontrant votre motivation, votre curriculum vitae, les copies des diplômes et attestations requis pour le poste et les 2 derniers certificats de travail.

Cette annonce s'adresse indistinctement aux femmes et aux hommes.

Souhaitant s’engager dans la lutte contre le chômage, les HUG encouragent les candidatures qui proviennent de l’Office cantonal de l’emploi.

Seules les candidatures soumises via la plateforme de recrutement sont prises en compte. Les candidatures papier et mail ne seront pas traitées.
Show more

Vous excellez dans le développement logiciel en équipe et dans des environnements complexes. Vous êtes également apte à faire des tests logiciels.

Vous possédez un esprit analytique avec une bonne résistance au stress. Vous êtes capable de travailler efficacement en équipe tout en alliant l’aspect technique et métier. Vous faites preuve d’un intérêt pour le monde hospitalier.

Informations supplémentaires

Horaires réguliers, travail de week-end, travail de nuit, piquets en fonction des besoins du service

  • Entrée en fonction : Dès que possible
  • Nombre de poste : 1
  • Taux d’activité : 80% à 100%
  • Classe de fonction : 20
  • Type de contrat : CDI
  • Délai de candidature : 13.06.2025
  • Demande de renseignement : Mme C. Rosset, responsable administrative et financière, tél 022 372 77 70

Votre dossier de candidature doit comporter une lettre démontrant votre motivation, votre curriculum vitae, les copies des diplômes et attestations requis pour le poste et les 2 derniers certificats de travail.

Title: Client Consulting Analyst, Visa Consulting and Analytics
Description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.



Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.





Job Description



What it's all about ...



Visa Consulting and Analytics (VCA) is the consulting arm of Visa, and drives tangible, impactful results for clients. Drawing on our expertise in consulting, data analytics, digital marketing and economics, VCA solves the most strategic problems for our clients.







Specific Responsibilities include:



Support a team of experienced professionals in delivering strategic consulting services to key Visa clients.



Complete detailed analysis on client data and identify preliminary trends and themes in the data with some guidance.



Conduct market research and data analysis to identify insights in the payment industry.



Support the development of client-specific presentations by adapting templates for unique client scenarios and needs.



Support senior consultants in developing and delivering high-quality advisory solutions to clients, such as business strategy, product development & pricing, customer segmentation and customer experience improvement.



This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 3 set days a week (Tuesday - Thursday), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs. 









Qualifications



What we'd like from you ...



Payment industry, digital payments or payment processing experience preferred.



Strategic and analytical thinking with a strong attention to detail that leverages multiple sources of information.



Able to understand and start to disaggregate problem statement into distinct pieces of analysis.



Use and adapt templates for unique client scenarios, optimizing structure to demonstrate + articulate key messages.



Ability to execute quantitative & qualitative analysis with some guidance.



Basic takeaways from the data + starting to craft storyline; ensure data quality + leverage data to support decision-making in project management.



Strong team player with a willingness to collaborate across levels and functional experts.



Strong multi-tasking skills and ability to adapt.



Proficient and ideally a power-user of spreadsheet and presentation tools.



An interest in learning advanced analytics tools (SAS, R, Tableau, etc.).



An interest in payments, financial institutions or consumer lending a plus.



An affinity for payments technology, FinTech and digital.



• Fluent English and German, both written and spoken (C2 level minimum)





Additional Information



Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: DeFi Data and Vault Operations Associate
Description:
Join our asset management team as a foundational member supporting the management of our expanding range of DeFi investment strategies. This role combines on-chain portfolio operations, smart contract analysis, and data engineering at the frontier of DeFi asset management.

As a DeFi Data and Vault Operations Associate, you'll take ownership of the backend requirements for daily vault operations, including related infrastructure, data pipelines, building smart contract roles & permissions, and contributing to due diligence on emerging protocols. This position offers exceptional growth potential and the opportunity to become a subject matter expert in the rapidly evolving area of DeFi asset management infrastructure.

The roleholder will be data savvy, analytical, operate with intellectual honesty, be curious and approach the role with a growth mindset.

Requirements

Responsibilities

Data Strategy, Infrastructure & Analysis


Develop data strategy and infrastructure across the business
Manage data pipeline for Avantgarde's on-going data requirements, including vault NAV & performance, fee calculations, and AuM monitoring
Build processes for any idiosyncratic on-going data requirements for on-chain mandates (NAV & performance data, custom oracles)
Liaise across the business to ascertain data requirements and become the owner of all data sources and their integrity for the business



DeFi Vault Operations


Contribute to end to end vault set up, liaising with clients, the Business Development team and Trade Ops to fully onboard new clients
Work with Business Development and Trade Ops to manage client flows and other client needs relating to vault operations
Become a domain expert in developing and maintaining Zodiac roles modifiers on Safe multisig wallets, including adding new protocol coverage, creating templates, and liaising with internal teams to ensure changes & updates are implemented across relevant mandates
Assist with programmatic vault interactions and designing vault automation
Input into monitoring processes for curation mandates



Research


Due diligence of on-chain vault infrastructure solutions and technical requirements from a vault curator's perspective
Contribute to vault research using on-chain data and analysis of vault activity
Monitor emerging vault curation opportunities across the DeFi landscape



Automation


Ability to build efficient process leveraging automation where appropriate e.g. python and AI
Contribute to vault automations and programmatic interactions at a smart contract level
Develop tooling to create solutions to streamline operations and reduce manual overhead



Work in partnership with Trade Operations


Build strong relationships with Trade Ops
Contribute to reporting requirements across the business
Contribute to Dune dashboard creation with Trade Ops
Engage in code reviews across asset management and Trade Ops



Experience

Required skills and competencies


Defi expertise: Deep enthusiasm for DeFi and an understanding of the blockchain economy
Vault operations: Hands-on experience with vault set up and management on EVM chains
On-chain data: Proficiency with sub-graphs, on-chain function calls and Dune
API literate: Experience working with RESTful APIs and GraphQL to access, retrieve, and update data
Data analysis: Strong analytical skills with practical application
Programming: demonstrated experience in programming for data analysis, including Python and SQL



Preferred Skills And Competencies


Experience with Zodiac roles modifiers a strong plus
Familiarity with executing on-chain transactions a plus
Experience with on-chain oracles a plus
Experience with AWS a plus
Experience beyond EVM chains a plus



Personal attributes


Self directed: strong initiative and ability to drive efficiency through process improvements S
Excellent communicator
Work ethic: strong work ethic and professional reliability
Adaptability: ability to thrive in fast-paced, dynamic environments while managing multiple priorities
Curious: willingness to self learn as well as being eager to learn from others



Qualifications


Degree in a quantitative field
5+ years experience in a data analytics or related role
Practical experience with smart contracts and EVM
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills



Benefits

What We Offer


Competitive compensation: salary + equity participation, 33 vacation days (including public holidays), paid parental leave
Professional Growth: exceptional learning opportunities in cutting edge DeFi and direct mentorship from a team of experienced DeFi and TradFi professionals
Flexible Work: remote-first culture with collaborative team environment
Innovation Focus: work with industry learning protocols and pioneering financial instruments
Global Impact: shape the future of DeFi and on-chain asset management



Culture and values

We are an inclusive organization actively promoting equality of opportunity for all candidates with the right mix of talent, skills, attitude, and potential. We welcome applications from diverse backgrounds and select based on individual merit alone.

Our Commitment: We do not discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Our Environment: We are committed to providing a workplace free from discrimination or harassment, where every team member contributes to an inclusive environment where everyone feels respected and valued.

Our Values


Passion: Driven by a love for what we do, our enthusiasm fuels our ambition to redefine the future of finance
Integrity: We adhere to the highest ethical standards, ensuring trust and transparency in every action we take
Innovation: Pioneering new solutions, we strive to stay ahead, never settling for the status quo
Accountability: Every team member takes personal responsibility, demonstrating commitment to our shared mission
Flexibility: We support a remote working model that allows our team to respond to opportunities with agility and resilience
Common Sense: We value practical judgment and clear thinking, making balanced decisions that align with both vision and reality

Title: Cat Data and Tools Analyst (6 month contract)
Description:
PartnerRe is a leading, privately owned, multi-line global reinsurer with a reputation of financial stability and strength, and a commitment to rebuilding businesses and communities after risk events around the world.



Our mission is to continue to be a financially stable and predictable business partner, supporting our clients with solutions tailored to their needs, delivering superior returns to our owner, providing rewarding opportunities for our people and making a positive contribution to society. To achieve this, we live by our values of Integrity, Performance, Collaboration, Straightforward Communication and Respect and Care.



Core to The PartnerRe Experience is our global nature. No matter where you sit in the company, you are part of something bigger. Our teams represent our truly international mindset, forging connections across office locations and all levels of the organization and building a network of mutual success. The result is a day-to-day experience that will allow you to:



Shape your own career



Grow in a supportive environment



Connect with a community of experts



Make an impact



View Home - PartnerRe Experience e-book to find out more about what it’s like to work at PartnerRe.



We are always looking for bright, proactive individuals to join our team!



Please follow our Careers page for all updates on new positions. We look forward to receiving your application.



PartnerRe is an equal opportunities employer.



Please join our company LinkedIn Page for all updates on new positions that are coming live.





Job Description



About this job:



The position is within the Cat Tools and Technology team, which is part of the Catastrophe Underwriting Office responsible for research, modeling, pricing, and portfolio analytics of natural catastrophes (Cat).



The Tools and Technology team is leading the developments of all the Cat applications in collaboration with IT to drive innovation and efficiency in managing risk of natural catastrophes.







About the role:



This temporary role supports the Cat Tools and Technology team in ongoing projects focusing on improving the reporting and analytics capabilities of the Catastrophe Underwriting Office unit.



In more detail your main tasks are to:



Enhance our existing reporting dashboard to improve efficiency and accuracy in assessing data quality and drivers of portfolio changes.
Replace existing Excel reports and integrate them into R Shiny dashboard.
Automate the production of existing reports through R Markdown.

The role will be based in Zurich.





Qualifications



About you:



You are passionate to apply your strong quantitative skills to the development of tools supporting the automation of processes and delivering business solutions.



The ideal candidate would have the following qualifications and personal qualities:



Master degree in computer science, data science, natural sciences (Climatology, Hydrology, Seismology, or similar), or a related quantitative field
Strong programming skills in R or Python and knowledge in databases (e.g., SQL or Snowflake)
Knowledge of R Shiny and R Markdown is a plus
Interest in data manipulation and data visualization
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Pro-active, solution oriented with a high level of self initiative
Ability to work well in a team and to contribute towards common goals
Proficient (written and verbal) in English


Additional Information











PartnerRe provides a working environment in which diversity is valued, where all employees feel welcome, respected, and empowered to perform at their best. We invite you to learn more about D&I at PartnerRe.



Thank you,



PartnerRe Hiring Team

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Votre futur employeur




Notre client est une prestigieuse institution financière à Genève.







Vos missions et contributions




En tant que Data Analyst, vous serez responsable de la collecte, de l’analyse et de l’interprétation de données stratégiques afin de soutenir la prise de décision dans l’entreprise. Vous manipulerez des volumes de données importants, développerez des visualisations et rapports sur mesure, et fournirez des analyses détaillées pour améliorer les performances et les processus internes. Vous participerez également à la mise en œuvre et au suivi des pratiques de gouvernance des données.







Missions principales




Gestion des données:

Analyser les données à intégrer dans l’entrepôt de données (DataWareHouse) et définir les règles métier associées.

Effectuer la maintenance analytique du DWH.

Fournir des analyses et rapports à destination des équipes métiers

Création de rapports et outils décisionnels:

Développer des tableaux de bord, visualisations et rapports interactifs à l’aide de Power BI.

Mettre à disposition des ensembles de données dédiés aux besoins métiers.

Optimisation et gouvernance des données:

Identifier les opportunités d’amélioration dans les processus de collecte et d’exploitation des données.

Contribuer activement à la gouvernance des données et à la gestion du catalogue de données

Assurer une veille technologique pour intégrer les meilleures pratiques et outils.







Profil recherché:

Formation : Diplôme en statistiques, informatique, mathématiques ou domaine associé.

Expérience : Plus de 4 ans dans un rôle similaire, au sein d’environnements bancaires ou financiers.

Expérience dans l’utilisation d’outils de Business Intelligence et de bases de données complexes.

Connaissance approfondie des problématiques liées à la gestion et à la gouvernance des données.

Expérience dans le secteur bancaire impératives.







Compétences personnelles:

Solides capacités analytiques et rigueur.

Autonomie et capacité à anticiper les besoins.

Esprit novateur et curiosité pour les technologies émergentes.




Compétences techniques requises:

Maîtrise de MS SQL Server et Power BI, bonnes connaissances Dynamics est un plus

Une expérience avec les outils Azure est un plus







Vous vous épanouirez dans cette organisation si vous possédez:

Un haut niveau de professionnalisme et de sens des responsabilités

Une approche proactive et agile

Un fort esprit d'équipe




Ce qui est proposé:

L’opportunité de rejoindre une entreprise établie et prestigieuse

Flexibilité, avantages exceptionnels et un excellent environnement de travail

Title: Energy Data Portfolio Intern
Description:
Contexte et environnement

About us:

TotalEnergies has developed a strong expertise in oil and biofuels, natural gas and electricity trading. Trading entities are based in Geneva, Paris, Houston and Singapore. TotalEnergies installed its European trading hub across in Geneva, which now bring together very large teams around trading activities: TotalEnergies Trading & Shipping (T&S) and TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP).

TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP) is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies. As such, it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution.

The Trading division in Geneva is responsible for optimising the purchase & sales portfolios of gas, electricity, CO2 emissions, dry bulk, and LNG in all recognised markets worldwide, in compliance with the Company trading guidelines.

In such context, TGP helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

Context & Environment

Fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and a team to produce quick results. Global trading environment involves communication to be sent and received in several languages.

The role operates within a changing energy market mainly due to environmental and regulatory impacts and requirements.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

Activités

Job Dimension:

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical trades on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies.

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst is responsible for data retrieval within their portfolio, coordinating with IT and the T/DSOs. This role includes controlling and analysing the retrieved volumes, addressing any disputes, and updating the deals in the ETRM. The team supports business development across additional markets and less-carbonized commodities.

The team acts as the direct liaison to market system operators, ensuring continuous data collection from various sources. They are responsible for comparing volumes, performing controls and analysis, and cleaning the data. This enables seamless and flexible access to accurate and robust data, which is then shared with both internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team collaborates with relevant departments to ensure the accuracy of volumetric data when implementing it into the trading system and reviews the robustness of all internal systems related to this data.

What you will do:

The Energy Data Portfolio Intern will work closely with the Energy Data Portfolio analysts on the French renewables scope.

Thus, your main tasks will be the following:


Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner in the EDM system and communicating to TSO/DSO to retrieve missing volumes
Analysing and controlling volumetric data daily to identify anomalies and inconsistencies before updating the ETRM.
Assisting and building with Energy Data Portfolio Analysts, dashboards, reports and alerts on volumetric data to improve the data quality.
Producing key performance measures and indicators around data quality of the assets.
In coordination with Energy Data Portfolio Analysts, request Guarantees of Origins issuance to EEX every month.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.



Profil du candidat

Your profile:


Educational standard required: Engineering or Finance background preferred.
Strong operational and data visualisation skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is nice to have – French, Spanish and Italian.



Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.
Show more

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

Title: Data- & Insights-Analyst (a)
Description:
Mit Insights Impact generieren. Du brennst für Daten, möchtest den Getränkemarkt im Detail verstehen und willst mit datenbasierten Insights echte Wirkung entfalten? Dann ist diese Rolle bei Red Bull AG genau das Richtige für dich. In einem dynamischen, internationalen Umfeld erwartet dich nicht nur eine spannende Marke, sondern auch ein modernes Office direkt beim Bahnhof Baar ZG, ein motiviertes Team mit Drive – und die Möglichkeit, dein analytisches Talent auf ein neues Level zu bringen.




Deine Herausforderung

Als Data- & Insights-Analyst bist du Teil des Category Management Teams und unterstützt zusätzlich das Field Sales Team. Deine Hauptaufgabe besteht darin mittels Datenanalysen & -visualisierungen Handlungsempfehlungen abzuleiten. Diese bist du auch in der Lage zu präsentieren und es macht dir Freude, diese mit unterschiedlichen Stakeholdern zu diskutieren!




Du analysierst Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen (NielsenIQ Paneldaten, interne BI Daten wie z.B. Aussendienst Performance oder auch Daten aus Marktforschungsstudien) und leitest daraus strategisch relevante Erkenntnisse ab
Du unterstützt das Category Management mit Visualisierungen, Dashboards (z. B. in Power BI) und Modellen zur datenbasierten Sortiments-, Platzierungs- und Promotionsoptimierung
Du bist Sparringpartner für das Aussendienst-Team und ermöglichst durch smarte Analysen effizientere Verkaufsprozesse und wirkungsvollere Massnahmen im Feld
Du analysierst Marktforschungsstudien zu Konsumverhalten und Shopper Insights und bringst die Resultate in Kundenworkshops überzeugend auf den Punkt
Mit deinem technologischen Know-how in Python, R, SQL und Snowflake entwickelst du automatisierte Reports, aussagekräftige Visualisierungen und smarte Entscheidungshilfen
Du wirkst aktiv mit in internen und externen Meetings – und bringst dein Wissen in internationale Austauschformate mit anderen Red Bull Insights Experts ein




Deine Qualitäten und Begabungen

Hochschulabschluss (FH/Uni) in Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL/VWL, Psychologie oder einem vergleichbaren Feld – ergänzt durch Know-how in Statistik oder Data Engineering
Idealerweise hast du erste Erfahrung mit Data Analytics im FMCG-, Retail-, Konsumgüter-, Versicherungs- oder Gastronomieumfeld gesammelt oder bist motiviert dich «on the job» einzuarbeiten
Du kennst dich mit Tools wie Python, R, Power BI, SQL und Snowflake aus – und hast Spass daran, komplexe Inhalte klar und verständlich aufzubereiten
Du bist analytisch stark, hast ein gutes Gespür für wirtschaftliche Zusammenhänge und kannst deine Erkenntnisse überzeugend präsentieren
Deine Muttersprache ist Deutsch und du verfügst über sehr gute Englischkenntnisse – Französisch ist ein schönes Extra
Dich zeichnet eine proaktive und selbstständige Arbeitsweise aus, du bringst Drive und Motivation für eigene Lösungswege mit




Du möchtest einen echten Mehrwert bei einer internationalen Unternehmung mit lokalem Spirit schaffen? Dich zeichnet ein analytisches Vorgehen mit Blick fürs grosse Ganze aus?




Dann freut sich Stefan Fritschi auf deine Bewerbungsunterlagen! Ein Motivationsschreiben, warum dich diese Position und Unternehmen anspricht, kann den Unterschied machen!

Show more

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Analyst, Data & AI Ethics - Research
Description:
Thomson Reuters is transitioning to a content-driven technology company with over a century of experience curating and classifying data and supporting professionals in complex domains that move society forward. With some of the most comprehensive and richly enhanced legal, regulatory, news, and tax data in the world, Thomson Reuters is a leader in delivering technologies that inform the way forward.

The AI Enablement team, part of the Data and Analytics function, is responsible for ensuring governance practices that support the company’s leadership and delivery of world-class data and AI enabled solutions. The Ethics Research and Compliance analyst will be a critical member of this team, supporting the enterprise with building and delivering ethical and trustworthy technology.

The successful candidate will be responsible for driving awareness and thought leadership on the standards and regulations on the horizon. Working closely with legal and compliance teams, the candidate will support the enterprise-wide awareness of global regulatory trends and developments from leading organizations like the ISO, IEEE, W3C, and OECD. The ideal candidate is a passionate legal and ethics researcher with a knack for influencing audiences through written communication, and other mediums. The candidate will play a critical role in the translation of legal requirements into technical policies and implementation plans.


this is an emerging field of practice, if you are passionate about data and model ethics but don’t necessarily meet all of the below requirements, you are still strongly encouraged to apply.



About the Role:


Partnering with our legal counsel, you will monitor and report on the latest developments in legislative and regulatory instruments as it pertains to key ethics principles – translating into technical policies and requirements
Partnering with our technology teams on the identification, development, and scaling of best practices, tools and techniques to comply and accelerate Thomson Reuters’ leadership in ethical data use and AI
Working closely with Data and Model stewardship network and stakeholders as a specialist consultant on data and AI projects across the organization – advising on upcoming legal and related trends and compliance best practices
Ensure that data and AI ethics policies and guiding standards are inclusive of the requirements necessary to meet the growing demands of data and AI related regulation and best practices – drafting new policies where necessary
Provide thought leadership, executive summaries, and insights on data and AI ethics and governance matters to colleagues across the organization – contribute to educational resources
Participate in data and AI governance policy and standard creation, management, and analyzing potential impacts of policy choices under consideration



About You:


Strong familiarity with developments and trends in ethical data and trustworthy AI – e.g. EU, UN, and other major players
Demonstrated understanding of AI governance activities including oversight mechanisms, documentation, development processes
Expert researcher and persuasive communicator – primarily in the written word
Strong understanding of global data and AI privacy principles and regulations (experience working with GDPR/Canadian Privacy Act an advantage)
Strong familiarity with data management, ModelOps and traditional software development life cycles – an asset
You are a solutions-oriented critical thinker with strong influencing and networking skills
You demonstrate the ability to discover solutions for technical/business issues and to develop actionable insights and recommendations
You have the capability to work autonomously and make independent decisions to meet deliverables with minimal oversight
1-2 years of experience, ideally within the domains of data management and responsible AI, or related work
Considered a strong asset – Masters degree or higher - higher education and certifications within the fields of technology law, data management, machine learning and AI, and/or technology ethics



What’s in it For You?


Hybrid Work Model: We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected.
Flexibility & Work-Life Balance: Flex My Way is a set of supportive workplace policies designed to help manage personal and professional responsibilities, whether caring for family, giving back to the community, or finding time to refresh and reset. This builds upon our flexible work arrangements, including work from anywhere for up to 8 weeks per year, empowering employees to achieve a better work-life balance.
Career Development and Growth: By fostering a culture of continuous learning and skill development, we prepare our talent to tackle tomorrow’s challenges and deliver real-world solutions. Our Grow My Way programming and skills-first approach ensures you have the tools and knowledge to grow, lead, and thrive in an AI-enabled future.
Industry Competitive Benefits: We offer comprehensive benefit plans to include flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days off, access to the Headspace app, retirement savings, tuition reimbursement, employee incentive programs, and resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
Culture: Globally recognized, award-winning reputation for inclusion and belonging, flexibility, work-life balance, and more. We live by our values: Obsess over our Customers, Compete to Win, Challenge (Y)our Thinking, Act Fast / Learn Fast, and Stronger Together.
Social Impact: Make an impact in your community with our Social Impact Institute. We offer employees two paid volunteer days off annually and opportunities to get involved with pro-bono consulting projects and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives.
Making a Real-World Impact: We are one of the few companies globally that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.



DISCLAIMER

The above information in this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

About Us

Thomson Reuters informs the way forward by bringing together the trusted content and technology that people and organizations need to make the right decisions. We serve professionals across legal, tax, accounting, compliance, government, and media. Our products combine highly specialized software and insights to empower professionals with the data, intelligence, and solutions needed to make informed decisions, and to help institutions in their pursuit of justice, truth, and transparency. Reuters, part of Thomson Reuters, is a world leading provider of trusted journalism and news.

We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness, and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

As a global business, we rely on the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of all employees to deliver on our business goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law. More information on requesting an accommodation here.

Learn more on how to protect yourself from fraudulent job postings here.

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.

Title: Business Intelligence Spezialist/in 80-100%
Description:
Aufgaben

Als Business Intelligence Spezialist*in übernehmen Sie eine wesentliche Schnittstellenfunktion im Bereich Finanzen. Neben der Unterstützung der finanziellen Führung entwickeln Sie die BI-Landschaft des KSA weiter.


Erstellung von Datenmodellen, Dashboards, Reports sowie Durchführung von ad-hoc Analysen
Erfassen der Anforderungen der Fachbereiche und Umsetzung massgeschneiderter BI-Lösungen in enger Zusammenarbeit mit internen Teams und Lieferanten
Anbindung neuer Quellsysteme sowie Implementierung neuer Cubes und Datenbanken im Data Warehouse (DWH)
Wartung, Weiterentwicklung und nachhaltige Betreuung der bestehenden BI-Landschaft
Schulung der Mitarbeitenden im Umgang mit BI-Tools


Profil


Sie verfügen über eine höhere Fachausbildung im Bereich Betriebswirtschaft, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder über eine gleichwertige Qualifikation (HF, FH, Uni)
Sie bringen mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Konzeption und Umsetzung von BI-Lösungen mit
Erfahrung in der Erstellung von Reporting-, Analyse- und Dashboard-Lösungen mit BI-Tools (z. B. Power BI, Qlik Sense) wird vorausgesetzt
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Qlik Sense oder TIP HCe sind ein grosser Vorteil
Sie zeichnen sich durch ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten, strukturierte und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise sowie Teamorientierung aus
Ihr vollständiges Bewerbungsdossier in Deutsch wird vorausgesetzt


pMichael Wyss
Show more
HTML:
Aufgaben

Als Business Intelligence Spezialist*in übernehmen Sie eine wesentliche Schnittstellenfunktion im Bereich Finanzen. Neben der Unterstützung der finanziellen Führung entwickeln Sie die BI-Landschaft des KSA weiter.

  • Erstellung von Datenmodellen, Dashboards, Reports sowie Durchführung von ad-hoc Analysen
  • Erfassen der Anforderungen der Fachbereiche und Umsetzung massgeschneiderter BI-Lösungen in enger Zusammenarbeit mit internen Teams und Lieferanten
  • Anbindung neuer Quellsysteme sowie Implementierung neuer Cubes und Datenbanken im Data Warehouse (DWH)
  • Wartung, Weiterentwicklung und nachhaltige Betreuung der bestehenden BI-Landschaft
  • Schulung der Mitarbeitenden im Umgang mit BI-Tools

Profil

  • Sie verfügen über eine höhere Fachausbildung im Bereich Betriebswirtschaft, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder über eine gleichwertige Qualifikation (HF, FH, Uni)
  • Sie bringen mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Konzeption und Umsetzung von BI-Lösungen mit
  • Erfahrung in der Erstellung von Reporting-, Analyse- und Dashboard-Lösungen mit BI-Tools (z. B. Power BI, Qlik Sense) wird vorausgesetzt
  • Fundierte Kenntnisse in Qlik Sense oder TIP HCe sind ein grosser Vorteil
  • Sie zeichnen sich durch ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten, strukturierte und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise sowie Teamorientierung aus
  • Ihr vollständiges Bewerbungsdossier in Deutsch wird vorausgesetzt

pMichael Wyss

Title: Data Engineer junior (H/F)
Description:
StarQube développe une suite de solutions Front Office dédiées à l'organisation des données et à la construction de portefeuilles, conçues pour rationaliser les processus d'investissement, depuis l'acquisition des données, en passant par le backtesting rapide des stratégies définies par le client et la gestion des risques, jusqu'au rééquilibrage du portefeuille, à l'envoi des ordres et à la production de rapports. StarQube offre aux gestionnaires d'actifs un moyen agile d'automatiser chacun des processus de gestion de portefeuille tout en économisant sur les coûts de structure et de données.




Nous cherchons à pourvoir un poste de Data Engineer junior (H/F) localisé dans la région de Genève.


Vos missions



Acquérir l’expertise de l’utilisation de nos outils de manière à pouvoir accompagner nos clients dans la création de leurs processus d’investissement et de leurs rapports.


Analyser, comprendre et intégrer de manière élégante de nouveaux jeux de données à nos outils selon les besoins de nos clients.


Gérer la relation avec les clients sur les projets confiés (possibilité de déplacements chez les clients) et coordination avec les autres équipes de StarQube.


Utiliser l’expérience ainsi acquise pour contribuer à l’évolution de nos solutions en général.


Participer à la création continue de modèles financiers pour nos clients et prospects.


Participer aux efforts commerciaux de l’équipe de Business Development.



Vos compétences



Autonomie et rigueur avec un fort niveau d'exigence (orientation résultats, sens aigu des responsabilités). Vous aimez organiser et faire parler les données.


Master (ou équivalent) en computer science, ingénierie ou autre diplôme scientifique.


Connaissance d’un langage de programmation (p.ex. Java, Python).


Excellentes capacités de communication en français et en anglais.


À l’aise dans un environnement start-up.
Show more

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.
